programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three Lancashire couples compete to host the best dinner party and win a cash prize. Laidback Howard and his wife Lisa kick things off but fail to impress everyone with their lacklustre menu, before Michael and Jenni's evening leaves guests bored with table talk of transport, bemused by a collection of model busses, and repulsed by a rogue hair in the starter dish. Finally, Luke and Louise deliver a polished performance, which is let down by an over-cooked main course, before the winning couple is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan welcomes actor Frazer Hines through the doors of London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield to have a look at a magnificent equestrian bronze sculpture he is hoping to sell. At Nikolas Patrick in London, Charlie and Patrick consider a vintage luxury briefcase that may or may not be fake and a a vast collection of autographed sporting souvenirs, including match-used balls from the 2015 England Rugby World Cup.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, owner Dan and mum Lena are trying to seal the deal on some inflatable water-walking balls and a large collection of gold.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of property-hunters in Buckinghamshire and Berkshire. Having booked almost 40 viewings without success, newlyweds Hannah and Hassan want a four-bedroom house in the High Wycombe area with space for a full-size snooker table, while in Reading, sisters Gemma and Lucy insist on two of everything, from bedrooms and bathrooms to parking spaces.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: New series. Return of the programme helping buyers find a home providing a balance between town and country, with Lucy Alexander giving advice to a Kent couple and a Londoner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Water's Edge Guest House in Stratford-upon-Avon, where owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre enthusiast Jay Coleman hosts the first party in Newport, Gwent, putting on a dramatic evening with an international menu, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peace activist Pippa Bartolotti hosts the second of the week's dinner parties in Newport, Gwent, serving up a menu of locally sourced vegetarian food and hoping to entertain her guests by indulging in a spot of fortune-telling. However, a talkative Duncan Powell threatens to dominate proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Radio journalist Emma Jones hosts the third dinner party in Newport, Gwent, serving up an American-themed menu of crab cakes and pulled pork, and the 23-year-old tries to boost her chances of taking home the prize money with a cheerleading session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Sarah Kinnear hosts the fourth dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and her guests are encouraged to attend wearing `Welsh icon' attire. However, she takes a gamble when she engages in a lively dinner-table debate with Duncan and Pippa.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment boss Duncan Powell hosts the final dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and hopes his Hawaiian-themed evening will impress his guests enough to win the prize. Unfortunately for him, prawn brains and sea bass bones harm his chances of success, so the confident cook tries to rescue the evening with a lemon posset.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.sub-title: East London and South London Revisits.
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of property-hunters in London. In the east of the city, Kirstie finds out whether vicar Ian and his wife Peta successfully managed to downsize, while Phil catches up with Ben and Lucy, who hoped to find the ideal location south of the Thames.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit their property-finding mission in Aberdeen, which involved two couples who had relocated to the city for work. Helen Barr and Brian Clarence moved from Essex ahead of the arrival of their first child and had been residing in rented accommodation, while Kirsten and Scott Laing were living apart in Fife during the week and wanted a home that would bring them back together within a £200,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow Jody and Chris, who struggled with infertility, and are now awaiting the arrival of their first child at Liverpool Women's Hospital. There's also a look at expectant Mormon couple Cameron and Hannah, and Lesley, a single mum-to-be who plans on raising her baby alone.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Archaeologist Sophie hopes Second World War enthusiast Mark will be the man for her. Also entering the romantic restaurant is comedian Kelly, who worries that she tends to intimidate men. Can high-flying entrepreneur Russell handle her banter? Plus, mum-of-four Heather, 72, hopes retired businessman Gary will keep her company in her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett taking on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf. Adam Riches joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A look at weather at its strangest and fastest. A cloud envelops a supersonic jet, an invasion of tumbleweed swamps an entire town, apocalyptic black rain falls from the skies in Iceland, and an onlooker captures a rare fire rainbow on film. In Japan, a skier searches for legendary `snow monsters' on the slopes of a ski resort, while a storm chaser comes face to face with seven towering waterspouts in the Florida Keys. There's also a blood-red waterfall, and what explains the most otherworldly place on Earth, where there are two suns and no horizon?.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First up is 24-year-old Rebecca, a singer from Nottinghamshire who is tired of always having her heart broken by guys with a bad boy image and wants to see if choosing a date in the studio can help her pick a better mate. Next up is 25-year-old development manager Dan from Durham, who has unsuccessfully tried countless dating apps and hopes to find Mr Right.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man arrives at Luton police station claiming his life is in danger and that he has just escaped from a slave-owning gang that held him captive at a travellers' site in a remote part of Bedfordshire. Cameras follow as a major operation is launched to investigate the allegations, with more than 200 officers drafted in for a dawn raid on the site to arrest their suspects.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: This edition follows the case of a man who was attacked and left unconscious on the floor of a crowded pub for more than 30 minutes, but no-one is prepared to come forward and name the assailant. The next day, detectives from Bedfordshire Police seize CCTV footage from the pub and though they can clearly see the vicious assault, they are unable to easily identify who threw the punches. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the investigation as the officers try to overcome the wall of silence they face.(n)

programme.title: World's Most Expensive Cars
programme.desc: Ant Anstead heads to Monterey, California, to find out whether the Le Mans-winning Jaguar D-Type has got what it takes to become the most expensive British car ever sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Blackburn, Lancashire compete, beginning with beauty salon owner Carla and her fiance Marcus, the highly competitive Michael and Joanna and the more relaxed Trudy and Anselm. The parties include a risky chocolate souffle, a low-calorie trifle, and a curry that's far too hot for one of the diners.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, owner Dan and mum Lena are trying to seal the deal on some inflatable water-walking balls and a large collection of gold.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The owner of London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield has to deal with a bus-load of antiques and a watch once owned by Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, 200 miles away at Pickwicks in London, Nathan and Debbs value an impressive collection of jewels and watches, a set of antique coins and a pair of luxury designer handbags.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.sub-title: East London and South London Revisits.
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of property-hunters in London. programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander assists Muj and Sufia from Essex in finding a new home, and also helps engaged Maidenhead couple Adam and Jody who seek their first joint property in Buckinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Simran Samra hosts the first party in east London, and decides to cook meat for her main course, despite being a vegetarian. The fashionista tries to salvage her chances of winning the £1,000 prize by performing a range of comedy accents after fellow competitor Alan Price upsets one of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedienne Yoshki Greenberg hosts the second dinner party in east London, but her decision to surprise the guests by asking them to wear animal-themed pyjama suits does not go down well - leaving her struggling to win them over with a stand-up routine.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alan Price hosts the third party in east London, and sets out to impress his fellow competitors with a medieval-themed dinner. He hopes to raise the standard of the contest with an ambitious menu, but stumbles at the first hurdle when vegetarian diner Simran Samra panics at the sight of his authentic pig's head as the table centrepiece. Things do not improve as the night goes on, with dirty dinner plates and sloppy hosting leaving the guests less than impressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar owner Delia Elliot hosts the fourth dinner party from east London, and she is confident she can teach her young diners the protocol of entertaining guests. However, prankster Alan Price ends up having an argument with her, leading Simran Samra to take evasive action.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Doctor Chintu Gademsetty hosts the final dinner party in east London, and is confident of impressing his guests with a 1980s-themed evening. Even though his dance competition is not a hit with all of the diners, his food goes down a treat, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapman's careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great Gay Buildings
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by seven fellow celebrities to mark the 50th anniversary of the 1967 Sexual Offences Act, which decriminalised private homosexual acts between men. The group explores the histories of several buildings that became cornerstones in the battle for gay rights in the UK. The Rev Richard Coles revisits the hedonistic past of London's Heaven Nightclub, while Mary Portas visits Shibden Hall near Halifax to celebrate the life of 19th-century lesbian heiress Anne Lister. Craig Revel Horwood investigates Britain's drag scene at the Royal Vauxhall Tavern, and Simon Callow tells the story of Oscar Wilde's downfall at the Old Bailey. Plus, Rikki Beadle-Blair visit the Theatre Royal Haymarket to remember how the British public showed their support for John Gielgud after he was arrested for cottaging, and Liz Carr takes in Bletchley Park, the one-time home of Alan Turing. Finally, Waheed Alli tells the story of recent battles for gay right in the Houses of Parliament.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: New series. The popular 1990s game show returns - after last October's one-off revival as part of Stand Up to Cancer - for a full series, with comedian and film-maker Richard Ayoade stepping into the shoes of previous hosts Richard O'Brien, Edward Tudor Pole and Stephen Merchant. As the Maze Master, he will guide five intrepid celebrities - Ore Oduba, Vicky Pattison, Alex Brooker, Lydia Bright and Louie Spence - through the Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Future zones, where they play a range of skill, mystery, physical and mental challenges to win the all-important crystals. The more they win, the more time they have in the final test - the Crystal Dome.(n)

Plus, Stuart and Vic try to recover £5,000 owed by a forklift truck company after an agreement went sour.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary giving an insight into cash-strapped Britain from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments, including High Court enforcement bailiffs and repossession teams. programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours Of
programme.sub-title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of Heath Ledger.
programme.desc: Jason Payne-James re-examines the facts surrounding the death of the Australian actor, who was found dead in his New York apartment in January 2008. Ledger was 28 and appeared to be in the prime of his life, but the medical examiner concluded he died from an overdose. Was it a tragic accident or had the actor taken his own life? Using evidence from the post-mortem examination, together with the first-hand testimony of friends and colleagues, Payne-James investigates the Brokeback Mountain star's final hours.(n)

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart McCracken and Elmore Victor head to Liverpool for what they expect to be a routine repossession, but instead face the most challenging eviction of their careers. Behind the front door, they find a critically ill two-year-old child with major heart problems, who is on constant life support and unable to breathe without a ventilator. Meanwhile, Brian O'Shaughnessy and Del Anglin chase £2,000 worth of debt owed by a business based in Kent, and recover £4,000 from a recycling business in Buckinghamshire. Plus, Stewart and Elmore encounter another family in crisis in Birmingham, where a retired couple who acted as guarantor for their daughter's tenancy are liable to pay over £3,000 after she defaulted.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: In an episode inspired by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's wedding, the Prince of Canada prepares to wed his fiancee in a lavish ceremony. However, when the bride is abducted during the event, Canadians all over the world are sent a call to arms, one that is accepted by Kyle's little brother Ike.(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A mysterious man saves a pregnant woman from a gunman and helps to deliver her baby. However, when the relentless gang kill the mother and continue to pursue the newborn, he resolves to protect the child and find out why he is being targeted(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Greed is good: ambitious stockbroker Charlie Sheen sells his soul to corporate shark Michael Douglas. Oliver Stone's 80s classic shattered the American Dream(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Jacob and Will Grimm are a sibling pair of con artists specialising in taking advantage of peasant superstitions about witches and curses. But when they are called upon to investigate the disappearance of a number of girls from what is said to be an enchanted forest, they suddenly find themselves at the centre of what might just be a very dark, and very real, fairy tale(n)

programme.title: Gung Ho
programme.desc: Comedy about an unemployed man who manages to cajole a Japanese car company into re-opening its plant in his recession-hit town(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A Texas congressman uses his influence to supply Afghan fighters with money and arms in their battle against Soviet occupiers in the 1980s. Based on a true story(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars and directs in this, his twelfth film behind the camera but the first with a military setting. He plays a tough Marine drill sergeant at odds with the new generation of officers who charge him with whipping a platoon of misfits into shape. The irony is they're from his old battle unit but soon, his rigidity inspires them and, come the invasion of Grenada, they are a crack fighting unit(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A futuristic cyborg is sent to present-day Los Angeles to assassinate a woman, who will bear the child who will someday save humanity(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: William Peter Blatty's Oscar-winning adaptation of his bestseller about a child possessed by a demon(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: In this thrilling and inspirational sci-fi drama, a lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: A musician works with mobsters to advance his career but falls in love with the girlfriend of a gangland kingpin(n)

programme.title: Off-Air
programme.desc: Off-Air(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman find love in the Outback in Baz Luhrmann's sweeping drama(n)

programme.title: Dead Presidents
programme.desc: On the streets they call cash dead presidents. And that's just what a Vietnam veteran is after when he returns home from the war only to find himself drawn into a life of crime. With the aid of his fellow vets he plans the ultimate heist -- a daring robbery of an armored car filled with unmarked U.S. currency!(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two ageing friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on holiday together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: A compelling tale of the unlikely friendship that develops between a bigoted Korean War veteran and an Asian teen who, under threat from some gangbangers, tries to steal his car: a cherry 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Scientist Bruce Banner (Edward Norton) have been living in shadows, seeking a cure to his unique condition, which causes him to turn into The Incredible Hulk, a giant green monster, under emotional stress. But the military forces who dream of abusing his powers won't leave him alone. Upon returning to civilization, Banner is ruthlessly pursued by a nightmarish beast whose powers match The Hulk's own. A fight of comic-book proportions ensues as Banner must call upon the hero within to rescue New York City from total destruction(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss, Dan Hedaya and Seymour Cassel star in this comedy about mobsters who come out of retirement for one last job. Facing eviction from the hotel where they live, the guys try to scare off the owners with a staged shooting. But the plan backfires, and a hilarious comedy of errors begins. Carrie-Anne Moss, Jennifer Tilly(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Comedian Cedric the Entertainer serves as both producer and star of this comedy about a family who discovers just how much can go wrong en route to a family get-together. When Nate Johnson (Cedric the Entertainer) is invited to a big family reunion in Missouri, he sees it as an opportunity to reconnect with his estranged wife and growing children, as well as a chance to show up his wealthier know-it-all brother, Mack (Steve Harvey). Nate takes delivery on an expensive new SUV, persuades his recently separated wife, Dorothy (Vanessa L. Williams), to tag along, and packs up his three kids -- nubile teenager Nikki (Solange Knowles), under-age wannabe rapper D.J. (Bow Wow), and precocious seven-year-old Destiny (Gabby Soleil) -- for what he imagines will be a leisurely drive from Los Angeles to St. Louis. However, between his wary wife, arguing kids, angry police officers, bizarre hitchhikers, bad diner food, and an unfortunate run-in with a cement mixer, getting from point A to point B proves to be just short of a nightmare. Johnson Family Vacation was the first feature film for director Christopher Erskin, who previously distinguished himself directing music videos for the likes of Missy Elliot, TLC, and Boyz II Men(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A group of teenagers mysteriously die seven days after viewing a strange videotape. The aunt of one of the teens sets out to learn the truth and finds herself in the same scenario. With only a week to solve the mystery, she reaches out to her tech-savvy ex to uncover the tape's secrets(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author and Beckett find giant footprints at the site of a vicious murder and are forced to confront the unlikely theory that Bigfoot is the killer. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A high-level insurance executive is murdered, and suspicion soon falls on the father of a dying nine-year-old whose claim for a life-saving leukaemia treatment was turned down. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Two room-mates are found bludgeoned to death in their flat, and the handyman is the prime suspect. As his options run out, he takes a hostage, forcing Southerlyn into a course of action that could jeopardise her career. Award-winning police drama, guest starring Gene Silvers, and Elisabeth Rohm.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A marine recruiter is found dead on a civilian shooting range - but there is no blood at the crime scene and evidence suggests he died elsewhere. Horatio uncovers evidence suggesting the killing could be linked to the death of a soldier during combat in Iraq, prompting a second homicide investigation to be launched. Crime drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team members are surprised when Gibbs asks DiNozzo's father to join them in their investigation of a murder committed at the US Naval Academy. However, Tony Sr's experience turns out to play a vital role in the inquiry, which finds the team members hunting for a missing nuclear weapon they suspect is about to be sold on the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Finch is in Decima's custody, having sacrificed himself for the release of his ex-fiancee. Fully aware he will be killed once Samaritan comes online, he tries to convince Greer that a malevolent supercomputer could pose a threat to all mankind. Meanwhile, Root's team arrives in New York, where they hole up in a safe house and search for Samaritan's location.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The team takes desperate actions in its race to prevent the malevolent AI program Samaritan from coming online and making them its first targets. Meanwhile, the months-long battle with the anti-surveillance terrorist group Vigilance comes to a shocking conclusion. Crime drama, starring Jim Caviezel.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The wife of a zealous defence lawyer is found dead in her car, but Briscoe and Green suspect the victim's husband was the real target, and set off on the trail of a former client - a convict who sent him threatening letters from jail. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of a woman whose scantily clad body is found on the Upper East Side. Initially believing her to be a prostitute, they learn she was a doctor who had been handing out unauthorised doses of a powerful drug. The hunt for her killer leads the team into a web of deceit and blackmail, with a Russian mobster and his son seemingly pulling the strings.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A wealthy businessman is killed at a charity event and suspicion falls on his wife, whose blood matches a sample found at the crime scene. However, it later transpires that she has a twin sister - and the victim had a double of his own. Crime drama, starring David Caruso, Adam Rodriguez and Khandi Alexander.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. The safe house is attacked, leaving Vance in hospital and Eli missing, with his bodyguard Amit Hadar dead. The movements of all the Palestinians are accounted for at the time of the attack, making it unclear who was responsible, and Ziva suspects her Mossad replacement Liat is hiding something. Drama, starring Michael Nouri, Cote de Pablo, Rocky Carroll and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy officer scheduled to testify in a forthcoming murder trial goes missing after receiving a threat at the safe house where he was staying, and the deputy district attorney asks the NCIS agents to locate him. One of their few leads is a dead turkey Tony and McGee find in the man's fridge, so they take it to Ducky for an autopsy. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a former marine killed during a drone strike on a terrorist target - but with the victim's family refusing to believe he would have returned to the Middle East willingly, NCIS officers try to determine why he was associating with a notorious Taliban bomb-maker. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The trial of an alleged rapist is brought to an abrupt halt by the death of his accuser, who claimed he had made her pregnant - and subsequent developments suggest the accusations may have been false. Detective drama, starring Mariska Hargitay, Christopher Meloni and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson receives an alarming call from a girl who seems to have been abducted. Establishing the child's name and gaining some background information provides a starting point, but her captor's ability with electronics makes convincing the agent's colleagues extremely difficult. Mariska Hargitay stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony travels to North Africa on the trail of missing agent Ziva, who is thought to have been tracking down a terrorist leader called Saleem Ulman. Intent on exacting revenge for her apparent death during a flight to Somalia, he is taken hostage by militants and discovers she is still alive - only to be given a potentially catastrophic ultimatum. Starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and the team investigate the death of a hotel employee who plummeted from a balcony, and are alerted to another case by the sound of gunfire. Rushing to the scene, they find a woman who has shot dead a man for attacking her husband - an incident that brings back painful memories for Stella, who once killed a boyfriend in self-defence.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: The unit receives a ransom note demanding the immediate release of imprisoned drugs kingpin Pulpo in exchange for the release of Antonio's son Diego. As the detectives work to secure the youngster's safety, it becomes clear that Voight is taking orders from someone outside the Chicago PD and appears to have an agenda of his own. Crime drama, starring Jason Beghe and Jon Seda.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: The owner of a security firm is found dead in a park, and when the team looks into his background, it turns out the victim had a lot of blood on his hands.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett's life is threatened when she steps on a pressure sensitive bomb. While the team members search for a way to disarm the explosive, Castle distracts her from the gravity of the situation by engaging her in a conversation about who first fell for whom. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate a state senator suspected of involvement in the disappearance of one of his aides. Their progress is hindered by a lack of evidence, but when her body is found in a marsh, the case turns into a murder inquiry. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green believe the fatal stabbing of psychologist Tracy Conley may be linked to confidential client information on her computer. They learn one of the files on her hard drive has been tampered with since her death - information that would have ensured a known rapist spends another five years behind bars. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Natalia is arrested for the murder of her abusive ex-husband Nick Townsend, but the team is sidelined from the investigation by Internal Affairs, leaving it up to Horatio and Calleigh to prove her innocence. In a separate investigation, a wealthy single man is found dead in his mansion - and subsequent developments reveal the two cases are related.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. The agents discover he is being targeted by terrorists who have hijacked a shipment of advanced weapons from the army. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Justine plans to surprise Seth with a warm welcome home from a fishing job in Alaska, but when he doesn't return as planned, she becomes concerned for his safety. Meanwhile, Jack informs Olivia that he has been offered a job that may take him out of town. Drama following the fortunes of Olivia Lockhart, a small-town judge, both inside and away from the courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Ex-con Larry, who was sentenced by Olivia and has served his time, arrives in town and asks her for the help he needs to get his life back on track. However, when the town's wooden pergola is set on fire, he becomes the chief suspect. Drama following the fortunes of a small-town judge, starring Andie MacDowell.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A former soldier comes to trial for the murder of a Yemeni immigrant he suspected of being a terrorist. With the events of September 11 still fresh in everyone's minds, McCoy tries to find a way of ensuring the jury's fears and prejudices do not influence their verdict. Award-winning police drama, starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the fatal shooting of two professors, which occurred soon after one of the academics campaigned against the treatment of women in the Middle East. Their inquiries lead them to a Muslim with strong beliefs - and an extreme dislike of females. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the team investigate the case of a Hollywood star whose body has been found in the boot of a car on a film set. The celebrity rehab centre where he had been staying becomes the focus of their inquiries, especially once they discover the victim was about to expose a number of damaging secrets. Starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate the murder of a marine during a cruise. They discover he came from a famous and wealthy family but had turned his back on a life of privilege to join the military, and after the death of his father had inherited a large part of his business. His decision to change his will may have pushed one of his relatives to kill him to keep the firm in their control. Crime drama, guest-starring Diane Neal (Law & Order: Special Victims Unit).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy recruitment officer is murdered at a high school and the agents discover he had recently begun a relationship with a married teacher whose wife held a grudge against him. They also find out a student's father was vehemently opposed to his joining the military, and receive help from an unexpected quarter - Ducky's esteemed predecessor, Dr Magnus. Crime drama, guest starring comedian Bob Newhart.(n)

programme.desc: Stabler investigates an assault case involving his former partner's teenage son, who assaulted a female friend during a drug-induced rage. programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Dizzy Detectives. Gorillas, both fake and (supposedly) real, play a big part in this amusing Three Stooges comedy two-reeler. The boys are policemen masquerading as night watchmen in an attempt to trap a burglar dressed in a gorilla suit. They catch a gorilla, all right, but the beast proves to be real. The denouement is appropriately violent; the ferocious simian blows up after ingesting nitroglycerin. John Tyrrell, probably Columbia Pictures' busiest character actor, earned a major spot in this two-reeler, playing the wanted burglar. The studio liked the plot enough to remake it twice: Fraidy Cat (1951) and Hook a Crook (1955), both starring Joe Besser, who in 1956, replaced Shemp Howard as the third Stooge(n)

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: The entire team that brought us Jurassic Park is back in action for this colossal sequel which features more dinosaurs, more special effects and much more of a story. Richard Attenborough returns as John Hammond, the millionaire who has funded a major research project which has successfully recreated living, breathing dinosaurs using their DNA. In this movie, Hammond reveals the existence of a second island off the coast of Costa Rica, where even more dinosaurs are roaming around within a self-contained eco-system. First to reach the island is scientist Dr Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum), along with his girlfriend Dr Sarah Harding (Julianne Moore) and a documentary team who aim to study the prehistoric creatures in their 'natural' environment. But they are swiftly followed by a team of mercenaries intent on capturing the dinosaurs and transporting them back to the civilized world - the consequences of which could be disastrous!(n)

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park

programme.title: Minority Report

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: In the science-fiction thriller Species (1995), Natasha Hentsridge appeared as the beautiful but deadly Sil, a human-alien DNA combo. In this sequel, Hentsridge portrays Eve, a government experiment concocted to gain an understanding of how to combat future aliens, while Michael Madsen and Marg Helgenberger repeat their roles from the earlier film. When astronaut Patrick Ross (Justin Lazard) returns from the first manned Mars expedition, he's infected with the same DNA that spawned Sil and Eve. Hailed as a hero, Ross is pressed into politics by his father (James Cromwell), a senator. Any woman who beds the sexually active Ross is immediately impregnated, with embryos quickly developing and killing the mother. Ross hides the offspring on a family estate, as LA cops begin to detect a pattern in the female deaths. At the lab where scientists are monitoring Eve, Dr. Laura Baker (Helgenberger) realizes that Eve has a telepathic link with Ross, and that these two hybrids hope to couple. Press Lennox (Madsen) and Colonel Burgess (George Dzundza) figure Eve can be used to lead them to Ross. Cleared as a murder suspect, Mars mission astronaut Dennis Gamble (Mykelti Williamson), joins Lennox and Baker and gets in on the action as everyone involved closes in on Ross. Richard Belzer does a cameo as the President of the U.S., while Peter Boyle makes an uncredited appearance as a scientist(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2

programme.desc: In his breakthrough Hollywood role, Robin Williams stars in Barry Levinson's black comedy as DJ Adrian Cronauer, assigned to the US Armed Services Radio station in Vietnam. His outrageous quip-laden, cynical broadcasting style, matched by his choice of records, immediately lands him in hot water with the top brass but his popularity with the soldiers in the field saves his bacon. But as the war comes closer to home (he barely survives a bomb attack) and he becomes involved with a Vietnam girlfriend, he is forced to take both himself and the war a little more seriously(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: The Gathering Storm. Documentary telling the full story of World War II with the aid of rare and unseen archive footage, recently released official documents, modern colourisation techniques, state-of-the-art satellite-delivered terrain mapping and graphics. In the run-up to September 1939, political and economic chaos in the aftermath of World War I allowed Hitler in Germany, Mussolini in Italy and ultra-nationalists in imperial Japan to seize absolute power. When Britain, France and the United States failed to confront initial acts of aggression, contempt for their weakness prompted Germany and Italy to intervene in the civil war in Spain and Hitler to make a series of land grabs which brought Europe to the brink of war. Ep. 1 (Followed by News)(n)

Crucially, Britain now had radar and the Enigma code had been broken. After the Battle of Britain, Churchill commenced the fight back(n)

Shirley worries about Mick's wellbeing.(n)

Donna Jackson returns to Holby City, but clashes with Fletch's authority and questions whether too much has changed for her to simply pick up where she left off.(n)

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: The arrival of Helen's brother Daniel immediately ruffles feathers when he gets into an argument with his sister's neighbour, Carl. Father Michael attempts to mediate, but when things escalate further, he's torn between doing what's right in the eyes of the law, and what he feels may resolve things between the two men without causing more upset to the grieving Helen. Elsewhere, Chloe Demichelis wants answers from the long suffering Michael. Drama, starring Sean Bean, Muna Otaru and Danny Sapani.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with Laverne, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance. Last in the series.(n)

With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Finals Starter.
programme.desc: It's finals week as the eight winners of the regional heats do battle to get their dishes on the menu for the banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. The chefs begins with the starter course, with Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the BBC's coverage of the tennis tournament for more than 20 years and a former British number one.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Reid and Jackson have a morbid plan to smoke serial killer Nathaniel Dove out of hiding, but Shine is on their trail and will stop at nothing to track them down, including the brutal intimidation of whoever he thinks might be protecting them. Reid also has other problems of his own when the papers portray him as a murderous vigilante, leading to his daughter's opinion of him being shattered. Meanwhile, Susan enlists the help of trusted friends in the search for her young son - but not without grave risk to their safety.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week

Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight

programme.desc: In the series finale, Louis XIV learns the names of the nobles who purchased the poisons, but a last fatal batch reaches the palace, and humiliated Madame de Montespan has a plan for it. Facing a flaming death, brazen Madame Agathe predicts doom for the King and his royal line, while Sophie is torn emotionally and traitorous Thomas realises Philippe is only acting affectionately to feed him misinformation, making their final bedroom tryst a bloody affair. Last in the series.(n)

Ellie also goes on a wildlife safari inspired by one of the featured books and joins a team spotting and tracking adders with radio transmitters. Plus, Adam Henson reports on technology for preventing droughts and John Craven presents an update on the Countryfile Photographic Competition.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Volcanoes have long helped shape the Earth, but what is less well known is that there are volcanoes on other planets and moons that are even more extraordinary than those on our own home planet. Cameras follow a team of volcanologists in Iceland as they draw parallels with the volcanoes on Earth and those elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: The Isle of Sheppey.
programme.desc: New series. Nick Knowles travels to the Isle of Sheppey in Kent to meet two extraordinary dads, Garry and Kyle, who have adopted four vulnerable children - three of whom have special needs - to give them the best life possible. But their cramped three-bedroom bungalow is making family life difficult. So to give this family the space they so desperately need, the DIY SOS builders are undertaking their most ambitious project yet - to demolish the bungalow and build a bespoke five-bedroom house in its place. But with just nine days to complete the task, it looks like being their toughest one yet.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Kate Humble hosts the panel show that tests the wildlife knowledge of captains Chris Packham, Lucy Cooke and guests Steve Backshall and Ajay Tegala in a variety of rounds.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Architect Piers Taylor and property enthusiast Caroline Quentin explore unusual homes built in mountainous regions. They begin in California, viewing a property built from the wings and tail fins of a Boeing 747. In Arizona, the pair stay in a modern house with an innovative take on an ancient technique of absorbing the heat during the day and releasing it at night. In New Zealand, Caroline and Piers view a house camouflaged using cedar cladding, while their last stop takes them to an hexagonal alpine chalet with a steel chimney core that anchors it to the mountain.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Final Fish.
programme.desc: The eight regional champions cook their seafood courses, but with some high scoring dishes in the regional heats each chef will need to deliver perfection to see off the competition. Experts Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver are joined by guest judge Tim Henman, former British Number One, who competed in Wimbledon's semi-final on four separate occasions.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow Glendon from Preston who has Glioblastoma, a form of brain tumour. He has identified an immunotherapy drug, and wants to self-fund a course, so he seeks advice at Charing Cross Hospital's private wing. Elsewhere in London, Nicky from Devon has travelled to Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea Hospital to receive NHS treatment not available at her local hospital for her ovarian cancer.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: New series. The return of Mackenzie Crook's award-winning comedy in which he and Toby Jones star as metal detector enthusiasts in search of their hearts' desire. Andy is considering internet dating. Not for him, but for Lance, who is still not over the departure of his ex-wife. Meanwhile, a mysterious stranger arrives to tempt the metal detecting club - in more ways than one. Real-life mother and daughter Diana Rigg and Rachael Stirling co-star, with Gerard Horan and Sophie Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future.
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the fourth leg of his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne in Middlesbrough, visiting one of the last iron foundries in the town and helping cast a carrot valve for a steam engine. His next stop is Darlington, Co Durham, where he meets the editor of the Northern Echo and finds out about the colourful history of WT Stead, one of his predecessors. Michael then heads to St Paul's monastery in Jarrow, Tyne and Wear, to learn about eighth-century monk the Venerable Bede, known as `the father of English history', before finishing in Hexham, Northumberland, where he visits a historic ginger beer emporium.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Japanese Life
programme.desc: James Fox explores the art of the Japanese home, the clean minimalism of which has been exported round the world from modernist architecture to lifestyle stores. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln.(n)

programme.title: Lucy Worsley's Reins of Power: The Art of Horse Dancing
programme.desc: Expert historian, yet novice rider, Lucy Worsley learns the 17th century art of horse ballet leading up to a public performance. Along the way, she explores the origins of this peculiar pastime, witnesses spectacular displays abroad and discovers its surprising legacies.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: The Woman Who Swims with Killer Whales.
programme.desc: New Zealand marine biologist Dr Ingrid Visser does not regard swimming with orcas to be dangerous, and does so regularly enough to know the local ones by sight. She sets out to investigate an unusually high number of deaths among the creatures in a year-long period between 2010 and 2011, and her findings reveal disturbing information about the state of the world's oceans.(n)

programme.title: The Fantastical World of Hormones with Dr John Wass
programme.desc: The consultant physician, one of the country's leading experts on hormones, reveals the weird and wonderful stories behind some of the regulatory biochemicals. John explains how juices were once extracted from testicles in the hope they would rejuvenate elderly men, and reveals how Canadian doctor Fredrick Banting discovered insulin. He also looks at how hormones are being used in the battle against obesity.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Japanese Life
programme.desc: James Fox explores the art of the Japanese home, the clean minimalism of which has been exported round the world from modernist architecture to lifestyle stores. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Newcastle on the final leg of his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne, finding out about the world's earliest swing bridge and its inventor William Armstrong. He also travels by boat from the port of Seahouses to examine the story of lighthouse keeper's daughter Grace Darling, who, along with her father, rescued nine people from tumultuous seas in 1838. On the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, Michael explores the lime kilns and finds out how Christianity spread from here across northern England in the 7th century.(n)

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison: The Search for Modern Medicines
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley's three-part documentary exploring the history of medicine concludes as he tells the story of how scientists went from finding antidotes to poisons to applying otherwise dangerous toxins as a cure. He reveals why he believes, of all the natural remedies featured in his scientific tour, the tales of treatments derived from deadly substances are perhaps the most extraordinary he encountered. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hokusai: Old Man Crazy to Paint
programme.desc: Biography of the world-renowned Japanese artist Katsushika Hokusai, whose print The Great Wave off Kanagawa helped make his name. With Andy Serkis reading the voice of Hokusai, the film features artists David Hockney and Maggi Hambling, and scholars who study, admire and venerate this Japanese master.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: With girl bands and pop music permeating Japanese life, cameras follow the cultural phenomenon driven by an obsession with young female sexuality and internet popularity.(n)

programme.title: Who Should We Let In? Ian Hislop on the First Great Immigration Row
programme.desc: As Brexit Britain prepares to draw up new rules on who is welcome in the UK, Ian Hislop explores the decades from the Victorian era to the First World War, when modern Britain introduced its first peacetime restrictions on immigration. Until then, the Victorians had an open door to foreigners, but rising numbers in the late 19th-century triggered a fierce disagreement over who should be allowed in, mirroring the ongoing modern-day debate.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: And the Horse He Rode in On.
programme.desc: A handsome Jewish doctor makes Grace's day when he saves her - on horseback - from being late for her insemination. Meanwhile, Karen is tempted to cheat on her jailbird husband. Guest starring Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Jack lands his dream job as personal assistant to actor Kevin Bacon, and Grace is visited by Dr Leo Markups, who makes her a tempting offer. With Harry Connick Jr and Rip Torn.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Ray grow irritated by Robert and Amy's over-the-top displays of affection - especially when the pair start giving them relationship advice. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Gianni is hired to do some work on the kitchen, but infuriates Debra with his laziness. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Jon Manfrellotti and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin prepares for his first night's work as a security guard, and while the gang agonises over who will be landed with walking Eddie, he recalls his traumatic last day as a policeman. To add to their problems, Daphne and Niles each buy a ticket to rival concerts on the same night.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz goes on a date with a dustman, while Niles reminisces with Daphne about his childhood, and Frasier throws a party for the staff at the radio station in a bid to improve his image. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles has too much to drink at a Halloween party, and Frasier is taken aback to discover the children in his complex are afraid of him. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Tracey and Gareth Sadd love the northern part of Tenerife and are keen to find a bolt-hole that they can escape to regularly. Presenter Jasmine Harman searches the local market to find properties to match the couple's £110,000 budget in the hope that they'll like one of them enough to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from south-west London compete for the £1,000 prize, beginning with butchers Roland and Anne. Second host Penny hopes that her organisational skills can help her gain points, but partner Thom's revelation threatens to embarrass her. Fancy-dress enthusiasts Tony and Rebecca host the final evening, with a dessert based on Tower Bridge and a starter resembling a rugby pitch.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The owner of London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield has to deal with a bus-load of antiques and a watch once owned by Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, 200 miles away at Pickwicks in London, Nathan and Debbs value an impressive collection of jewels and watches, a set of antique coins and a pair of luxury designer handbags.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with sports presenter Colin Murray joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a man searching for a home in the Cotswolds that will help him recover from a serious stroke, while also giving him easy access to the countryside and London.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Poacher Inn in South Warnborough, Hampshire, where landlady Nadia Schicchi hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Chris kicks off a week of competition from places near the border between Essex and Suffolk, hoping to win the £1,000 by treating his guests to a night of fine dining.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Halloween-inspired tales featuring the all-American family. Springfield becomes the target of an alien invasion and Homer is transformed into a gigantic jelly-like creature, rampaging through the town and leaving a trail of destruction in his wake. Featuring the guest voice of Dr Phil.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Hunter is devastated by Neeta's decision, while Prince returns and Lily breaks down in his arms. Elsewhere, Cleo begs Shane to keep quiet, and the Cunninghams look for a lodger.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.sub-title: Brexit - How to Get a British Passport: Channel 4 Dispatches.
programme.desc: Datshiane Navanayagam investigates just how hard it can be to get a British passport and the real impact that the lack of one has on many people's lives. She reveals there are already 120,000 children and young people born or raised in the UK who think that they are British, but who will not automatically gain citizenship, and she also examines the huge costs involved in applying for citizenship and how the Home Office assesses claims, and asks whether Brexit will make the situation worse.(n)

programme.title: How to Stay Well
programme.desc: Javid Abdelmoneim tests the theory that eating food off the floor could be good for people's health, Helen Lawal investigates the possibility of an invasion of supernits and Phil Kieran plays guinea pig to find out if reading in the dark can lead to blindness.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: This edition follows the case of a man who was attacked and left unconscious on the floor of a crowded pub for more than 30 minutes, but no-one is prepared to come forward and name the assailant. The next day, detectives from Bedfordshire Police seize CCTV footage from the pub and though they can clearly see the vicious assault, they are unable to easily identify who threw the punches. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the investigation as the officers try to overcome the wall of silence they face.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: Ewan has a surprise opportunity for wealth beyond his wildest imaginings, but there are strings attached as he finds himself on the horns of an unusual moral dilemma. Josh and Abi are attempt to be a normal couple by pretending that he isn't a millionaire, Watto realises that being poor doesn't make him a good person, and Leon comes to an understanding about the true value of money, and finally resolves his relationship with Case. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: My Millionaire Dads and Me
programme.desc: Documentary following millionaires Tony and Barrie Drewitt-Barlow and their family, who came to fame in 1999 as the first British gay fathers to pay for surrogate mothers. Sixteen years later, their eldest children are about to celebrate a milestone birthday, and their parents are planning an extravagant party to celebrate, including expensive coming of age presents. The programme follows the family across a year of social events, gifts and GCSEs as they struggle to combine life as a `normal' family with the demands of the media.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets a woman with a surgery-free solution to enlarging her assets - inflatable N-cup breasts. The programme also features Glen, who has vowed to transform his wife's body from white to black, and a woman who regrets an eyebrow raise that has left her seeing double. Plus, Julian cannot work out why he had such protruding pec implants, and a child minder wants to defy her mum with large tattoos on the backs of her legs.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre ER
programme.desc: Stories include a young lady who pays the price for a discount piercing, and a car crash victim who survives against the odds. Narrated by Tom Davis.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: The team pits luxury chocolate brands against cheap versions, and Anna Richardson and Andi Osho investigate which big brand crisp packets contain the most air. Plus, how to get the cheapest ticket for movie blockbusters, and what do the scientific claims on moisturisers and face washes really mean?.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Four popular brands of cheese and onion crisps come under scrutiny and the three supermarket staples appearing on the conveyor belt are fresh tortelloni pasta, coffee and sausages. Joining the panel are this week's food heroes - Italian chef Francesco Mazzei, Charlotte Mitchell, the only female butcher to win a young British foodie award, and coffee roaster and award-winning barista James Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces a new challenge when he is called upon to save the life of a buzzard with a broken wing. A couple's beloved labrador turns up at the clinic with badly damaged elbow joints, and a pampered cat that is used to living the good life faces surgery to repair slipping knee-caps.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the secret life of the animals of Chester Zoo, one of Britain's most popular zoos, using new micro-rig technology to capture the behaviour of the animals and their close relationships with their keepers. In the first episode, the zoo's Asian elephant family welcome a new arrival. Grumpy matriarch Thi has been pregnant for almost two years and is reaching the end of her tether. She's given birth to a stillborn baby in the past, so the keepers have a close eye on her. Cameras also follow Red panda Jung, who has been getting the cold shoulder from his partner Nima since they had two cubs.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Transporter Shahbaz wins the auction to move a fragile £15,000 art collection 385 miles, from Market Harbrough to Paris, while Raymond and Grant pick up items including a trampoline and polo shirts, and Laurie delivers one of the Gruffalos 17 hours late.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The house-hunters are in the West Country, where Phil Spencer meets a couple who are looking to put down roots after years of moving around the country because of the husband's job in the RAF. Meanwhile, Kirstie Allsopp helps a newlywed couple who have £175,000 to spend on their first home. However, a chance encounter with a neighbour over a garden fence takes their search off in an entirely new direction.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with sports presenter Colin Murray joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: The Kid Stays Out of the Picture.
programme.desc: Will has to wait another month for an answer to the insemination issue while Grace focuses on her relationship with Leo, leading to a big argument.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen and Jack conspire to sort out Will and Grace's differences over parenting by getting them to attend the birthday party Joe and Larry are throwing for their daughter. Eric McCormack and Debra Messing star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy invites her brother for dinner, but he ends up outstaying his welcome, forcing Robert to take desperate measures to eject him from the couch. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra begin telling lies in a bid to cover up previous falsehoods, but Marie soon suspects what they are doing. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Doris Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Domestic disharmony causes chaos in Frasier's apartment, leaving Martin's beloved chair ruined and the carpet soiled. Meanwhile, Roz begins piano lessons. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink celebrates his 2,000th radio broadcast and is disappointed to find he has a recording of every show but one, forcing him to turn to an obsessive fan for a copy of the elusive tape. Guest starring computer tycoon Bill Gates.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier befriend Kirby, whose girlfriend's grandfather is a well-known wine connoisseur. Martin is forced to wear a device to monitor his blood pressure. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Liverpool couple John and Pauline McDonough both have demanding jobs in the pharmaceutical industry and want to find a relaxing bolt-hole to escape to in Spain's Granada province. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties starting at just under £86,000 in the hope that they will make an offer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stable-owner Alice and her boyfriend Ollie, travel specialists Gareth and Hihine, and newlyweds John and Katy compete over three evenings in Cambridge to host the best dinner party.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and his sidekick Debbs seal the deals on an unusual life-size Majolica lion, a rare book, and racing silks owned by jockey AP McCoy. Meanwhile, at Dan's London Road Shop in Sheffield, the team values a selection of high-end rubies and an unusual astronaut jukebox.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Colin Murray is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Edinburgh's Lisa and Fiona find a home near to open spaces, and Chichester couple Charlotte and Sam, who are looking to buy their first property together.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury B&B will impress.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night from Essex/Suffolk, and it is the turn of salon owner Sam to cook. She has opted for a good looking, simple menu, but foodie Chris is not impressed.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is duped into enlisting in the army, and falls foul of a hard-nosed officer who uses him as the target in a training exercise. Escaping back to Springfield with troops in hot pursuit, he makes his way home - where Marge's ingenuity saves the day. With the guest voice of Kiefer Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A new face arrives in Hollyoaks village, while Hunter turns to Lily for help, and Yasmine tricks Kim. Elsewhere, Shane manipulates Cleo to withdraw Goldie's saving account after stealing her bank card.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr around the tasting table this time are First Dates' Fred Sirieix, food critic Giles Coren, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panel choose between four different brands of smoked salmon, gin and the ready meal favourite lasagne. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test samples milk chocolate, something Brits spend around a billion pounds on each year.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho reveal which chocolates and biscuit brands to avoid when it comes to price. They look at how much it really costs to get a `free' coffee from the nation's biggest chains. The team also investigates travel insurance, and the high cost of West End theatre tickets.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Exploring life at Liverpool Women's Hospital through the eyes of male midwife Chris, a former navy trauma medic. Cameras also follow 22-year-old Kiefer, the birthing partner for his girlfriend Sophie. Following life-threatening complications during the birth of their first child, can he hold it together this time?.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: `Deadly' (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, he's shy and retiring with the ladies. Can he bring his A-game when he meet teaching assistant Helen? Other diners include rock fan Anthony, who meets retired nurse and fellow northerner Barbara. She's an amateur magician with a few dating tricks up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. programme.desc: Turbot is walking a tightrope, only for seagulls to threaten his act - and when he is left dangling, the Paw Patrol race to the rescue.(n)

programme.desc: While the pups prepare for a tree dedication ceremony, Alex sets up his own mini- patrol and recruits Chickaletta, Cali, Turtle and Bunny.(n)

programme.desc: Mr Elf demonstrates why it takes so long to make flour, but Nanny Plum refuses to wait, and uses magic to speed up the elf windmill.(n)

programme.desc: All of his friends have won the Great Soapbox Race before, but Digby has only ever come second and this year he is determined to win - but so is Grizel.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The youngster tries to get Daddy Pig fit and healthy.(n)

As the copycat crimes continue, she finds herself racing against time to catch the killer before they strike again. Mystery, starring Candace Cameron Bure.(n)
