programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: A ranch hand hitches a ride on a stagecoach after losing his horse, but things go from bad to worse when the vehicle is hijacked by outlaws. The cowboy tries to bargain for the release of his fellow hostages - a newlywed couple - but his pleas fall on stony ground once the bandit leader learns the new bride is a rich heiress. Western, with Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Sullivan and Henry Silva.(n)

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: A cowboy recruits a trio of outlaws to rescue a woman held captive at a Comanche camp and reunite her with her husband in return for a large reward. However, his partners decide the bounty should be split three ways rather than four and plan to double-cross him. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins and Skip Homeier.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: An American couple on holiday in Morocco witness the killing of a local man they have befriended. Before dying he whispers a secret that has serious political implications - but they are prevented from telling the police when their son is kidnapped by a gang of spies bent on keeping them silent. Alfred Hitchcock's remake of his own 1934 thriller, with James Stewart, Doris Day, Bernard Miles and Daniel Gelin. Featuring Day's performance of Oscar-winning song Whatever Will Be, Will Be (Que Sera, Sera).(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A wealthy Texan hires four mercenaries to rescue his wife, who has been abducted and taken to Mexico by a bandit gang. However, when they find her, she refuses to leave and they have to take her by force - ending in a cross-border chase with the outlaws on their trail. Western adventure, with Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Woody Strode, Jack Palance and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: Two science teachers investigate a mysterious meteor and discover it is oozing a strange fluid containing millions of minuscule but rapidly evolving organisms - which start to turn into terrifying alien monsters with a taste for human flesh. Sci-fi comedy, starring David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Julianne Moore, Seann William Scott, Dan Aykroyd and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: The Monuments Men
programme.desc: Seven experts in fine art are assembled into a military platoon during the Second World War, and given an unusual mission. They are sent into occupied Europe to recover priceless works of art that have fallen into Nazi hands and ensure the masterpieces survive the conflict. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett.(n)

programme.title: Joe
programme.desc: Self-destructive ex-convict Joe offers a job to a 15-year-old boy living with his abusive father. Joe is moved by the teenager's devotion to his family in the face of hardship and forms a paternal relationship with him. When the youth faces a threat he cannot handle, Joe tries to redeem his past mistakes by protecting him. Drama based on Larry Brown's novel, starring Nicolas Cage and Tye Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Beasts of the Southern Wild
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl's father falls ill, and the sickness seems to have a destructive effect on the world around them. As the sea levels rise and prehistoric monsters return to life, the child must go in search of her estranged mother to find a way to restore balance to the natural order of things. Fantasy, starring Quvenzhane Wallis and Dwight Henry.(n)

programme.title: Comanche
programme.desc: A powerful Native American chief agrees to take part in peace talks with Washington after an encounter with a sympathetic scout. However, a group of renegade warriors are unwilling to surrender their arms and their actions prompt a bigoted government official to use brutal methods. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Kent Smith, Nestor Paiva and Henry Brandon.(n)

programme.title: The Ladykillers
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind and his gang come up with a cunning scheme to steal a fortune, but their plan is threatened by the unsuspecting elderly landlady of the boarding house they are staying in. They decide to dispose of her, which proves easier said than done. Classic Ealing comedy, with Alec Guinness, Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Katie Johnson, Cecil Parker, Danny Green and Jack Warner.(n)

programme.title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
programme.desc: A burnt-out British spy is ordered to venture undercover in East Germany. He begins by faking his resignation and subsequent alcoholic depression to dupe the enemy into trusting him, but, as he becomes further embroiled in his mission, he comes to realise that he is merely a pawn. Espionage thriller, based on John Le Carre's novel, starring Richard Burton, Claire Bloom, Oskar Werner and Peter Van Eyck.(n)

programme.title: The War Wagon
programme.desc: A convict is released from prison and swears vengeance on the corrupt mining contractor who took his gold-rich land. On the way, he encounters an old enemy who reveals that the gold from the mine is about to be transported in an armoured stagecoach - and suggests they join forces to steal it. Western, starring John Wayne, Kirk Douglas, Bruce Cabot and Howard Keel.(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: A washed-up Hollywood screenwriter takes a job at a small university, planning to exploit his position as a local celebrity and do as little work as possible. His cynical outlook begins to change when he falls for a single mother working toward her degree, while a talented pupil makes him consider what he wants from his life. Romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Marisa Tomei, Allison Janney and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Work on the promotional film gets underway, and Maxwell and Drummond compete for a role.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy ends up in hospital following an incident at the tennis court.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Gasforth's finest are called in to police a group of rowdy environmentalists protesting against a proposed bypass - one of whom just happens to be Inspector Fowler's girlfriend Patricia. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and Serena Evans.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor tempts fate by agreeing to look after neighbours Patrick and Pippa's house while they're away - a situation made even more volatile by the arrival of his brother Alfred, who proceeds to rub him up the wrong way. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Richard Pearson.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Profile of Les Dawson, who was famed for his deadpan, world-weary comedy style and plentiful jokes about his wife and mother-in-law, illustrated by his numerous appearances on TV chat shows. Narrated by Dawn French.(n)

programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.desc: In the concluding episode, Paul O'Grady charts Bob Monkhouse's reinvention as the elder statesman of British comedy from 1994 to his death in 2003, and sees how at the end of his life Bob was performing some of his most outstanding comedic work.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: The One Ronnie
programme.desc: Comedy show from 2010 in which Ronnie Corbett takes centre stage to celebrate his 80th birthday. Guests David Walliams, Matt Lucas, Miranda Hart, Rob Brydon, Catherine Tate, Lionel Blair, James Corden, Harry Enfield, Richard Wilson, Robert Lindsay, Jocelyn Jee Esien and Jon Culshaw join in the fun with a series of sketches and routines, while the man himself will be performing one of his signature armchair monologues written by Ben Elton. With music by Charlotte Church.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Gasforth's finest are called in to police a group of rowdy environmentalists protesting against a proposed bypass - one of whom just happens to be Inspector Fowler's girlfriend Patricia. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and Serena Evans.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor tempts fate by agreeing to look after neighbours Patrick and Pippa's house while they're away - a situation made even more volatile by the arrival of his brother Alfred, who proceeds to rub him up the wrong way. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Richard Pearson.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers that an infirm friend needs help to bury his pet in the churchyard, and calls on Alvin and Entwistle to carry out the deed. However, the mission becomes complicated when the police begin to suspect the trio are up to no good. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Burt Kwouk and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Behind Every Bush There Is Not Necessarily a Howard.
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists his friends in a scheme to help Toby win back his ex-wife - but finds she only has eyes for Morton. Meanwhile, Howard tries to keep Pearl from interfering with his bike ride with Marina, and Cooper and Walsh test a new piece of in-car technology. Long-running rural comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Trevor Bannister, Peter Sallis and Burt Kwouk.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Pearl throws Howard out of the house, prompting him to declare he has sworn off women for good - but Hobbo and friends take it upon themselves to get him to talk to Marina first. Meanwhile, Cooper and Walsh have their car valeted after receiving complaints from the sergeant, Glenda tries to whip herself and Barry into shape in time for Gloria's wedding, and Hobbo finds it difficult to avoid Miss Davenport's attentions at the library.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: The One Ronnie
programme.desc: Comedy show from 2010 in which Ronnie Corbett takes centre stage to celebrate his 80th birthday. Guests David Walliams, Matt Lucas, Miranda Hart, Rob Brydon, Catherine Tate, Lionel Blair, James Corden, Harry Enfield, Richard Wilson, Robert Lindsay, Jocelyn Jee Esien and Jon Culshaw join in the fun with a series of sketches and routines, while the man himself will be performing one of his signature armchair monologues written by Ben Elton. With music by Charlotte Church.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan announces she is running a stall at the city farm to promote the supermarket's new organic range, but her husband couldn't be less interested. He wants to know why he, of all people, hasn't been invited to a royal reception in Birmingham being attended by none other than Prince Charles. But then he hears His Royal Highness may be dropping in to the city farm, and he sees his chance - only to discover he still won't get anywhere near the future king unless he can impress the formidable head of the welcoming committee, Marina Fairchild (Belinda Lang, 2point4 Children).(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Shazia is looking forward to having fun with her friends as the day of her hen party arrives, only for a few unwelcome guests to tag along - and she ends up being bombarded with everyone's stories of married life. Meanwhile, Amjad has his stag do, which is being organised by his future father-in-law Mr Khan, so surely nothing can go wrong. Back at the house, the groom is put in a compromising position - and when the two parties collide, the wedding is left hanging in the balance. Kate Robbins guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The day of Shazia's wedding to Amjad finally dawns, but it doesn't get off to a great start when Mrs Khan falls out with her daughter and refuses to attend the ceremony. This leaves Mr Khan to sort out the mess - but in his none-too-subtle attempt to get his wife back on side, he only manages to make matters worse - then the groom goes missing and Mrs Malik makes a startling revelation.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee's attempt to impress Lucy with his knowledge of the art world backfires when she decides to invest a fortune in an unknown artist's work. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Kevin Bridges, Phill Jupitus and Sara Pascoe.
programme.desc: Kevin Bridges hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by DJ, Buzzcocks regular and all-round funnyman Phill Jupitus and actress-comedienne Sara Pascoe, making her Apollo debut.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: The duo decide a night on the town is in order and find themselves getting acquainted with a teenage goth at Lazerbowl. Jeremy perseveres with Toni, despite her love for Peter Gabriel, and Mark discovers a melon has more merits than a bowling ball.(n)

programme.title: Gimme Gimme Gimme
programme.desc: Linda embarks on a mission to assess whether Jez is capable of having an affair after a sobbing Suze tells her she thinks he is going through a mid-life crisis, while Tom lands an audition for Crossroads. Comedy, starring Kathy Burke and James Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Skits and sketches, including a spoof of Pulp Fiction. Guest starring Kate Moss and Lulu.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Kevin Bridges, Phill Jupitus and Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Holiday antics with 1970s pop group Slade on a camping trip, and a special edition of MasterChef. Plus, the Bra Men take a walk around an art gallery and Bob gets stuck in a glass jar.(n)

programme.title: Vic Reeves Big Night Out
programme.desc: The Living Carpets dine in Les' Lunch Club, Judge Nutmeg dishes out the punishment in That's Justice and The Man with the Stick continues to search for his kids. Surreal comedy, with Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Behind Every Bush There Is Not Necessarily a Howard.
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists his friends in a scheme to help Toby win back his ex-wife - but finds she only has eyes for Morton. Meanwhile, Howard tries to keep Pearl from interfering with his bike ride with Marina, and Cooper and Walsh test a new piece of in-car technology. Long-running rural comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Trevor Bannister, Peter Sallis and Burt Kwouk.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Pearl throws Howard out of the house, prompting him to declare he has sworn off women for good - but Hobbo and friends take it upon themselves to get him to talk to Marina first. Meanwhile, Cooper and Walsh have their car valeted after receiving complaints from the sergeant, Glenda tries to whip herself and Barry into shape in time for Gloria's wedding, and Hobbo finds it difficult to avoid Miss Davenport's attentions at the library.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: The chance of promotion looms and Fowler decides he needs to become more respectable, leading him to believe marrying Patricia might improve his image. Old enemy Grim is also after the plum post. Ben Elton's comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Hen-pecked batchelor Timothy comes to the aid of a young runaway, believing her fate rests in his hands. Starring Ronnie Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard).
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wondering if Pearl still loves him, Howard asks Hobbo to give her a peck on the cheek from him - only to become even more despondent when he sees his wife deliver a passionate kiss. Meanwhile, Glenda sends Barry off to paint a landscape, hoping the activity will distract him from his hunger - but fish and chips is the only thing on his mind. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an `Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Lee Nelson, Stewart Francis and Paul Chowdhry.
programme.desc: Cheeky Londoner Lee Nelson plays host for a `well good' session of stand-up from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by Canadian funnyman Stewart Francis and observational comic Paul Chowdhry.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark makes a new friend at a business conference and Jeremy reluctantly considers accepting Super Hans as a replacement flatmate - but soon decides against it. Offbeat comedy, starring Robert Webb, Olivia Coleman and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Roman's facial gets out of hand when estranged wife Bubbles interferes, and Dudley is shocked by Ting Tong's latest revelations, but cannot resist her tight green outfit. Orville is harassed in a supermarket and Marjorie Dawes gets star-struck when a celebrity addition to Fat Fighters arrives. Featuring guest appearances by Rob Brydon and former EastEnder Derek Martin (Charlie Slater).(n)

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.sub-title: KPMG Women's PGA Championship Special from Olympia Fields Country Club
programme.desc: KPMG Women's PGA Championship Special from Olympia Fields Country Club. Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal are headed to Olympia Fields Country Club to teach the short game shots the LPGA's best face in the KPMG Women's PGA Championship. There is also a special lesson with five-time major champion Phil Mickelson on what makes him one of the greatest of all-time with a wedge. Numerous LPGA players in the field stop by to share how they prepare for a major venue, and no trip to the Chicago area would be complete without a lesson in dealing with Windy City conditions(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish using a selection of seven ingredients - including sardines, endive, pistachios and pomegranate. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw takes viewers on a culinary journey to Japan, beginning by discovering the delights of sea urchin, pond smelt and boutique cheesecake on the country's northern-most island Hokkaido.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: Mary Berry makes a tennis cake based on the 19th-century recipe that was the technical challenge from Victorian week. Paul Hollywood makes two types of cream horns - the first filled with with a mocha creme pat and the rest with a limoncello tutti frutti cream. Plus, Mary demonstrates how to be delicate, precise and perfect with her mokatines and Paul gets to grips with an epic construction in choux pastry - le religieuse a l'ancienne.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the second heat. The six hopefuls begin by dishing up their Calling Card, a single plate of food that represents who they are, followed by the Invention Test, in which they rustle up a dish in one hour from a choice of two surprise sets of ingredients. After two cooks are sent home, things get serious, with the rest preparing dinner for three discerning guests - 2010 MasterChef winner Dhruv Baker, and Chris Gates and Hannah Miles, finalists from 2009 and 2007 respectively. It's then up to John and Gregg to decide which two will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the history of the Vegetarian Society and discover how the movement changed public attitudes and became part of the mainstream. They also consider how British gardening has influenced the nation's cuisine, and provide a few recipes along the way.(n)

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: In the second programme, Gordon Ramsay heads off the tourist trail into the north-east of India, where he examines some of the country's best-kept culinary secrets. He encounters a tribe of meat enthusiasts in Nagaland, searches for the perfect Assamese dish, and sets up a food stall in Calcutta to promote the delicacies he has discovered on his trip.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal celebrates Britain's iconic dishes, from roast beef and Yorkshires to pie and steamed puddings. He begins with fish and chips, discovering how the industrial age fuelled the proliferation of chip shops and setting out to create imaginative meals. Inspired by Henry VIII's chefs, he prepares fake fish skin from truffle, madeira gel and sea urchin to rest on top of a piece of turbot, and also attempts to blend and batter an entire chippy menu down to just one bite.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: Mary Berry makes a tennis cake based on the 19th-century recipe that was the technical challenge from Victorian week. programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: A pared-down approach to cuisine in which the domestic goddess reveals that what people cook and how they prepare it really can make them feel better and more alive. Nigella prepares her avocado toast with radishes for breakfast, a Thai noodle dish with cinnamon and prawns, and a laid-back family supper of seeded lamb ribs, served with a feta and avocado salad. Nigella also serves her warm-spiced cauliflowers and `chicksalad' and a sweet treat in the form of an apricot almond cake.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Istanbul.
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary tour of Europe, beginning in Istanbul, where she finds out how traditional Turkish fare is being transformed by a new wave of cooks.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from yesterday's heat return to face a skills test in which they must each skin a whole Dover sole and cook a portion on the bone in 12 minutes. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to prepare roast saddle of hare with red wine and mustard sauce from a basic recipe that contains no weights and measures. The contenders then prepare their own choice of dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: From 2011, 12 enthusiastic home-cooks take part in a culinary contest devised by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. In the first round, the competitors are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours, before being asked to bake a coffee and walnut Battenberg cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six more amateur cooks compete for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final, preparing a plate of food that represents who they are as their Calling Card and choosing one box of ingredients - either sweet or savoury - to rustle up a surprise dish in the Invention Test, before two of the hopefuls are sent home. The remaining four serve dinner for 2011 and 2012 MasterChef champions Tim Anderson and Shelina Permalloo respectively, as well as 2008 finalist Jonny Stevenson, before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace decide who has made it through.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the food provided by British waterways as they fly-fish for trout, prepare a meal of stuffed wild duck and discover how the Gloucestershire tradition of eating baby eels has virtually disappeared.(n)

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads south to Kerala to try what is considered the ultimate seafood curry, and also spends time in an ashram in Tamil Nadu where all the food is vegetarian. After giving bullock racing a go, the chef finishes his journey in Mumbai, where he visits the city's slums and cooks with one of India's leading chefs for a star-studded dinner in a hotel.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal discovers the origins of the British roast and serves up beef with all the trimmings to the people who make it possible - butchers and farmers. The chef tries out a roast chicken dressed as a medieval knight riding a pig into battle, and uncovers just how important beef was to Admiral Nelson and his navy. He also travels to Switzerland to find out how mould is used in laboratories to create aged meat, before preparing a joint made up of different cuts, all treated differently, and stuck together with meat glue.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates her favourite recipes for sharing with family and friends, including a tray of nourishing breakfast bars, a supper of crunchy chicken cutlets, and a dark and sumptuous chocolate cake. Plus she shows to make succulent belly pork burgers, which were inspired by a visit to a New York eatery.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Amalfi Coast.
programme.desc: The Amalfi coastline is the next stop on the chef's culinary journey around Europe, as she cooks a family meal at a cliff-side restaurant, and learns the secrets to some delicious dishes.(n)

The remaining four serve dinner for 2011 and 2012 MasterChef champions Tim Anderson and Shelina Permalloo respectively, as well as 2008 finalist Jonny Stevenson, before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace decide who has made it through.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates her favourite recipes for sharing with family and friends, including a tray of nourishing breakfast bars, a supper of crunchy chicken cutlets, and a dark and sumptuous chocolate cake. Plus she shows to make succulent belly pork burgers, which were inspired by a visit to a New York eatery.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Amalfi Coast.
programme.desc: The Amalfi coastline is the next stop on the chef's culinary journey around Europe, as she cooks a family meal at a cliff-side restaurant, and learns the secrets to some delicious dishes.(n)

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads south to Kerala to try what is considered the ultimate seafood curry, and also spends time in an ashram in Tamil Nadu where all the food is vegetarian. After giving bullock racing a go, the chef finishes his journey in Mumbai, where he visits the city's slums and cooks with one of India's leading chefs for a star-studded dinner in a hotel.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal discovers the origins of the British roast and serves up beef with all the trimmings to the people who make it possible - butchers and farmers. The chef tries out a roast chicken dressed as a medieval knight riding a pig into battle, and uncovers just how important beef was to Admiral Nelson and his navy. He also travels to Switzerland to find out how mould is used in laboratories to create aged meat, before preparing a joint made up of different cuts, all treated differently, and stuck together with meat glue.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: From 2011, 12 enthusiastic home-cooks take part in a culinary contest devised by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. In the first round, the competitors are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours, before being asked to bake a coffee and walnut Battenberg cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six more amateur cooks compete for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final, preparing a plate of food that represents who they are as their Calling Card and choosing one box of ingredients - either sweet or savoury - to rustle up a surprise dish in the Invention Test, before two of the hopefuls are sent home. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Wacky comedy about a singer who witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. As a result, the church's congregation swells until even the Pope comes to witness pop classics such as 'My Guy' performed to glorify the Lord. But, of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: In the sequel to the hit comedy Sister Act, Whoopie Goldberg reprises her role of Deloris Van Cartier, a Las Vegas entertainer who hid out with in a convent of nuns to avoid a nasty bunch of gangsters. In Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit, Deloris is persuaded to return to the convent by the Mother Superior (Maggie Smith), because her help is needed in teaching their choral students at St. Francis High in San Francisco. However, St. Francis is in a crisis, since the administrator running the school (James Coburn) is threatening to shut the place down. If the gospel choir wins first place in a singing contest in Los Angeles, St. Francis will be saved from the priest's plans. Though the plot is rather thin and derivative, Sister Act 2 is lighthearted fun, thanks to good musical numbers and winning performances from the cast(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Insecure as F**k. Two black women who are best friends navigate the pitfalls of their personal and professional lives in south Los Angeles in this comedy, which begins with Issa wondering if her relationship with her boyfriend is still worth the effort, while Molly's success as an attorney barely masks her dissatisfaction with her romantic prospects(n)

programme.title: Crossroads

programme.title: My Blue Heaven
programme.desc: Broad comedy about an affable mafioso who turns state's evidence and becomes a kind of fairy godfather to the strait-laced FBI man assigned to guard him. For his protection, he is rehoused in a small town in the back of beyond. But before long he reverts to his old ways and is frequently arrested by a vigilant DA - a stressed mother of two whose life is also in need of a makeover. Written by Nora Ephron, of 'When Harry Met Sally' fame(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: At the height of the Cuban missile crisis, Calvin Webber takes his pregnant wife Helen into a cavernous air raid shelter. Misinterpreting a plane crash as war, they spend the next 35 years entombed there. Their son, Adam, is brought up learning foreign languages, dancing, boxing and playing in the astro-turfed 'back yard'. When he is sent to get supplies from the world above, he meets Eve and, in this romantic comedy, discovers the good and bad sides of 1990s America(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: Enchanting children's fantasy, based on the classic novel by CS Lewis. When young World War Two evacuee Lucy Pevensie hides in an old wardrobe during a game of hide and seek, she finds herself transported to the magical land of Narnia, locked in eternal winter by the evil White Witch. Her siblings do not believe her when she tells them of this strange new world, but they are soon in Narnia themselves, fighting alongside the noble lion Aslan to defeat the witch and her mighty army(n)

programme.desc: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford. Counter-extremism expert Maajid Nawaz and attorney Richard Painter are the interview guests. The panelists are journalist Bianna Golodryga, political commentator Charlie Sykes and actor Bradley Whitford(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A witty script and a great ensemble cast add up to one of Woody Allen's most hilarious farces. Allen wrote, directed and stars as a washed-up filmmaker who is suddenly stricken with psychosomatic blindness on the eve of his big comeback(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: When a band of mysterious horse-riding warlords raid the Yaghal camp and kidnaps the beautiful Evolet along with many others, young mammoth hunter D'Leh is forced to lead a small group of hunters south to save her. Driven by destiny, the unlikely band of warriors must also battle saber-toothed cats and terror birds(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: A Southern matron forges a bond with her black chauffeur in the racially-divided 1960s South. Only when he is retired and she is confined to a home for the elderly do the two fully realize that they've been friends and kindred spirits all along(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Now fully recovered from his amnesia, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne attempts to uncover the truth behind his father's death in this pulse-pounding sequel. At the same time, he must evade the government forces hot on his trail(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 06-25-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 155. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Wacky comedy about a singer who witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. As a result, the church's congregation swells until even the Pope comes to witness pop classics such as 'My Guy' performed to glorify the Lord. But, of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: In the sequel to the hit comedy Sister Act, Whoopie Goldberg reprises her role of Deloris Van Cartier, a Las Vegas entertainer who hid out with in a convent of nuns to avoid a nasty bunch of gangsters. In Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit, Deloris is persuaded to return to the convent by the Mother Superior (Maggie Smith), because her help is needed in teaching their choral students at St. Francis High in San Francisco. However, St. Francis is in a crisis, since the administrator running the school (James Coburn) is threatening to shut the place down. If the gospel choir wins first place in a singing contest in Los Angeles, St. Francis will be saved from the priest's plans. Though the plot is rather thin and derivative, Sister Act 2 is lighthearted fun, thanks to good musical numbers and winning performances from the cast(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Insecure as F**k. Two black women who are best friends navigate the pitfalls of their personal and professional lives in south Los Angeles in this comedy, which begins with Issa wondering if her relationship with her boyfriend is still worth the effort, while Molly's success as an attorney barely masks her dissatisfaction with her romantic prospects(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 06-25-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonizing that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: My Blue Heaven
programme.desc: Broad comedy about an affable mafioso who turns state's evidence and becomes a kind of fairy godfather to the strait-laced FBI man assigned to guard him. For his protection, he is rehoused in a small town in the back of beyond. But before long he reverts to his old ways and is frequently arrested by a vigilant DA - a stressed mother of two whose life is also in need of a makeover. Written by Nora Ephron, of 'When Harry Met Sally' fame(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: At the height of the Cuban missile crisis, Calvin Webber takes his pregnant wife Helen into a cavernous air raid shelter. Misinterpreting a plane crash as war, they spend the next 35 years entombed there. Their son, Adam, is brought up learning foreign languages, dancing, boxing and playing in the astro-turfed 'back yard'. When he is sent to get supplies from the world above, he meets Eve and, in this romantic comedy, discovers the good and bad sides of 1990s America(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: Enchanting children's fantasy, based on the classic novel by CS Lewis. When young World War Two evacuee Lucy Pevensie hides in an old wardrobe during a game of hide and seek, she finds herself transported to the magical land of Narnia, locked in eternal winter by the evil White Witch. Her siblings do not believe her when she tells them of this strange new world, but they are soon in Narnia themselves, fighting alongside the noble lion Aslan to defeat the witch and her mighty army(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 06-25-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Long ago, on the planet of Cybertron, a massive, powerful alien race divided into two factions, the noble Autobots, and the devious Decepticons. They fought for the sole access to a talisman known as the Allspark, a cube with the capacity to grant infinite power(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford
programme.desc: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford. Counter-extremism expert Maajid Nawaz and attorney Richard Painter are the interview guests. The panelists are journalist Bianna Golodryga, political commentator Charlie Sykes and actor Bradley Whitford(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 156. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Groundbreaking. In the Season 6 finale, Selina and her staff get ready for the long-awaited groundbreaking for her library; Amy seeks clarity on her role; and Jonah asks Dan, Ben and Kent for help(n)

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Two gunmen become the marshal and deputy of a lawless Old West mining town and take on a corrupt rancher(n)

programme.title: Mission to Mars
programme.desc: A rescue mission is launched to investigate a mission to mars that ended in catastrophe and mysterious disaster(n)

programme.title: Everything Is Copy - Nora Ephron: Scripted & Unscripted
programme.desc: This moving documentary profiles multitalented writer Nora Ephron. Friends and family discuss the late Ephron's keen wit, her remarkable body of work—which includes everything from newspaper columns to classic films—and her private battle with leukemia(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A group of kids defend their Maine vacation home from knee-high alien invaders in this rousing adventure comedy for the whole family. Shortly after Bethany Pearson (Ashley Tisdale) and her family arrive at their summer home, four aliens show up and enslave her boyfriend Ricky via a powerful mind-control device. While the adults are completely oblivious to the extraterrestrial threat, the kids fight to save the planet with a little help from Sparks, the one friendly alien(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Comedy about a normally well-behaved teenager who goes wild while his parents are out of town. In charge at his parents' smart house, the 17-year-old sees the chance to make a fast buck when the hooker, on the run from a scary pimp, appears at his door. He takes her in, and, following his school's entrepreneurial teachings, lets her turn the house into a brothel(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry in this intense thriller. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: Bringing Out the Dead
programme.desc: A paramedic haunted by the ghosts of people he couldn't save struggles to stay sane while dealing with the madness of New York City's Hell's Kitchen in the early 1990s(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Server Error. In the Season 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Michelle Darnell is a successful businesswoman who is sent to prison after being convicted of insider trading. She tries to start over after being released, but not everyone is ready to forgive and forget(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Groundbreaking. In the Season 6 finale, Selina and her staff get ready for the long-awaited groundbreaking for her library; Amy seeks clarity on her role; and Jonah asks Dan, Ben and Kent for help(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Cyber Supremacy & Japan Rising. Ben Ferguson travels to Tel Aviv to see how Israel is leading the way on cybersecurity; Gianna Toboni reports on a right-wing movement in Japan to revive and strengthen its military might(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: When it comes to dating, Christina Walters has a golden rule: avoid searching for Mr. Right and focus on Mr. Right Now. That is until one night at a club when she unexpectedly meets Peter, only to see him suddenly disappear the next day. She and her best friend Courtney decide to break the rules and go on a road trip to find him, encountering numerous misadventures along the way(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorite figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: WCB: Ward vs. Kovalev 2
programme.desc: Light-heavyweight champ Andre Ward vs. Sergey Kovalev in a rematch in Las Vegas. Ward took the title from Kovalev last November by winning a hard-fought decision, with all three scorers giving him a 114-113 advantage(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: A charming 1960s con man poses as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer while eluding a dogged FBI agent who is determined to put him behind bars. Later, the swindler falls in love with the daughter of the District Attorney of New Orleans, LA which only serves to deepen his predicament(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: NewZealandTown. The prime minister of New Zealand wants to create 'New Zealand Town' in the bit between Chinatown and Little Italy. The boys want to play at the grand opening but he wants someone more cool - so Murray gets hold of some hair gel(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: In this exhilarating drama based on true events, legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: Wartime drama about a young man who is taught medicine by the doctor at the orphanage where he was brought up. When he clashes with his mentor over the issue of abortion, he leaves the home and finds work on a cider farm. There he falls in love with another man's girlfriend, but starts to re-evaluate his principles when one of the farm workers becomes pregnant by her own father(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, the illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their names and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. However, the mogul soon turns the tables, and forces the group to steal a revolutionary decrypting device for him(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: An investment banker attempts to cope with his wife's sudden death by becoming obsessed with physically deconstructing technologies that surround him. His complaints to a vending machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer service rep(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: Jason Schwartzman stars in this quirky comedy as an ambitious prep-school student. While he flirts with expulsion, he also cultivates a romantic fixation on a teacher, and befriends a local steel magnate (Bill Murray) who encourages the teen's dreams. Olivia Williams, Seymour Cassel, Brian Cox, Mason Gamble(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators battle a malevolent entity that's haunting a family living in a remote farmhouse in this terrifying tale of the supernatural(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Cyber Supremacy & Japan Rising. Ben Ferguson travels to Tel Aviv to see how Israel is leading the way on cybersecurity; Gianna Toboni reports on a right-wing movement in Japan to revive and strengthen its military might(n)

programme.desc: 06-25-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter joins forces with a witch to stop a plague that could decimate the population of New York City(n)

programme.sub-title: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford
programme.desc: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford. Counter-extremism expert Maajid Nawaz and attorney Richard Painter are the interview guests. The panelists are journalist Bianna Golodryga, political commentator Charlie Sykes and actor Bradley Whitford(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Server Error. In the Season 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Bruce Willis returns once again as John McClane, the wisecracking, old-school New York cop whose impressive CV includes rescuing hostages captured in a swanky LA plaza and saving passengers on a hijacked plane circling Washington. In this violent thriller, he's up against a group of terrorists threatening to hack into the US computer infrastructure. When they crash the stock market, sending the economy into meltdown and causing panic on Wall Street, McClane turns to young hacker Matt Farrell. Farrell's wanted by the FBI, but he's also potentially the only man who can help figure out the cyber criminals' next move. When the terrorists respond by kidnapping McClane's daughter Lucy, it's time for the anxious father to load up his ammo clips and go get the bad guys - just as the country's descending into chaos(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorite figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: A janitor at MIT, Will Hunting has a gift for maths that can take him light-years beyond his blue-collar roots, but to achieve his dream he must turn his back on the neighborhood and his best friend. To complicate matters, two strangers enter the equation: a washed-up shrink who starts to coach Will through his transformation, and a med student who shows him that there can be a pretty face along with his life of the mind(n)

programme.title: Scream 2
programme.desc: Wes Craven directs this funny and frightening sequel to the movie which breathed new life into the horror genre. When the gory events of the first film are made into a movie, Stab, the survivors find themselves terrorized anew by a knife-wielding man in a terrifyingly familiar Hallowe'en mask. With the characters as aware of the conventions of sequels as the audience, the movie pokes fun at itself, yet still manages to raise a scream or two(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: The final instalment in this hugely successful trilogy, takes place in Hollywood during production of "Stab 3, Return To Woodsboro". The production is a thriller which raises troubling questions about the events that terrified Woodsboro and continue to haunt Sidney Prescott. Three and a half years after leaving Windsor College, Sidney has settled in to a life of quiet seclusion in Northern Carolina. But that uneasy peace is shattered when terror erupts on the set of "Stab 3". Hotshot TV presenter Gale Weathers is called to the scene by the LAPD as the ultimate expert on the previous murders, and is reunited with Dewey. Will they survive to tell the tale this time?(n)

programme.desc: The strait-laced nephew of Sgt Joe Friday and his easy-going partner in the Los Angeles Police Department try to bust a criminal conspiracy between a pornographer and an evangelist(n)

programme.title: The Rescue
programme.desc: A team of Navy Seals are sent to destroy a disabled submarine so it will not fall into the wrong hands(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: Funny and perceptive comedy-drama about the trials and tribulations of parenthood, focussing on four different families all within one extended clan, with Steve Martin heading the cast as an over-protective father having problems with his anxious son. Great turns from everybody else in the huge and impressive cast(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: An advertising executive gets into a terrible auto accident and awakens to find himself in heavenly Judgment City. There he learns he must meet with a bureaucratic panel and defend his existence. If he persuades them that he lived a productive life free from unnecessary fear, then he will be admitted into Heaven. If he fails, he must go back to Earth and try again. Since the executive had been a notoriously selfish coward during his earthly existence, he definitely has his work cut out for him(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: Jason Schwartzman stars in this quirky comedy as an ambitious prep-school student. While he flirts with expulsion, he also cultivates a romantic fixation on a teacher, and befriends a local steel magnate (Bill Murray) who encourages the teen's dreams. Olivia Williams, Seymour Cassel, Brian Cox, Mason Gamble(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Comedy about a soldier who is thrown out of the army and ends up training a group of junior cadets(n)

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: Death brings a contentious family together (though that doesn't mean they get along) in this comedy-drama from director Anna Chi. When elderly Mrs. Xiao (Lisa Lu) dies in her sleep at home, her housekeeper and close friend Viola (Talia Shire) contacts her four adult children in hopes they'll come home to help with the funeral. Unfortunately, Mrs. Xiao didn't have many friends besides Viola, her children all have issues with her, and given her zeal to assimilate into American culture, the siblings are more than puzzled that she insisted upon a traditional Chinese funeral lasting a full seven days. Alexander (Russell Wong), a successful doctor, is still coming to terms with his overly strict mother and philandering father, and is unexpectedly reunited with his ex-wife (Kelly Hu), who he lost through his own infidelity. Elizabeth (Julia Nickson), a writer, also crosses paths with her former spouse (Adrian Hough) while she mourns both her mother and her young son. Victoria (Francoise Yip) has never been able to forgive her mom after she rejected her for marrying an African-American. And MeiMei (Steph Song), an actress, is a lesbian who wants to have children with her significant other Deedee (Bai Ling); they've been having trouble finding a suitable sperm donor, though they think one of the monks at the funeral may be just what they're looking for. Dim Sum Funeral received its world premiere at the 2008 AFI Fest(n)

programme.title: Down Periscope
programme.desc: As punishment for a near-miss with a Soviet vessel, a maverick skipper is given a leaky sub to drive. The admiral is worried about old hulks being commandeered by terrorists, so Captain Dodge has to test whether this one can still float(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: An unemployed young man avoids his father and a bully while trying to help his best friend pay back a debt to a drug dealer(n)

programme.title: Hairspray

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Comedy about a soldier who is thrown out of the army and ends up training a group of junior cadets(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.title: Continental Divide
programme.desc: Cynical reporter Ernie is sent out of town by his editor when one of his investigations ends in death threats. So he's dispatched to interview an eagle conservationist in the mountains(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: (1977) Mel Brooks' love of parodying film genres ( Young Frankenstein, Blazing Saddles ) continued with this affectionate spoof of Hitchcock's films, including Psycho, North by Northwest and Vertigo . Brooks plays Dr Richard H Thorndyke, new chief of the Psychoneurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous. There are mysterious disappearances, attempts on his life and scary Nurse Diesel (Cloris Leachman), whose closet is full of whips, as the gags fuel the delightfully crazy plot. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: Farce in which a convicted petty thief who escapes from jail finds a filofax belonging to an uptight executive and decides to track down the owner and claim the promised $1,000 reward for its return, but he quickly finds himself mistaken for the owner. The crook is whisked off on the adman's hectic schedule, leaving the real high flyer stranded without money or contacts on the dangerous streets of Los Angeles(n)

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: Alex Hesse and Larry Arbogast are working on a new drug which will reduce the chances of a woman's body rejecting an embryo and thus causing a miscarriage. When their research funding is withdrawn, and human experimentation is denied to them, they decide to test the drug by breifly impregnating Hesse. Hesse however becomes attached to "his" unborn baby(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: When it comes to dating, Christina Walters has a golden rule: avoid searching for Mr. Right and focus on Mr. Right Now. That is until one night at a club when she unexpectedly meets Peter, only to see him suddenly disappear the next day. She and her best friend Courtney decide to break the rules and go on a road trip to find him, encountering numerous misadventures along the way(n)

programme.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
programme.desc: Jeff Stilson. Jeff Stilson's routine covers a range of subjects, including divorce, men in delivery rooms, and math problems regarding bungee jumping. Taped in San Francisco at the Fillmore Auditorium(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jimmy Tong (Jackie Chan), un taxista que ahora tiene el oficio de chófer, aprende pronto que a la hora de trabajar para el playboy millonario Clark Devlin (Jason Isaacs) sólo existe una regla: jamás se debe tocar el esmoquin, el traje de etiqueta que tant(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

He takes her in, and, following his school's entrepreneurial teachings, lets her turn the house into a brothel(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Jamal Woolard stars in George Tillman Jr's biopic of the Brooklyn gangster rapper Biggie Smalls, AKA The Notorious B.I.G. (but better know by his mother Voletta - who co-produced the movie - as Christopher Wallace). Early on, the young Smalls shows interest in writing and performing rap with his friends, but he soon drifts into a life of drug dealing instead. Smalls' fortunes look to improve when a demo tape of his music is noticed by big time producer Sean Combs (who also co-produced the movie, and is played by Derek Luke), who signs the rapper to his Uptown Records label, on the understanding that Smalls will forsake his narcotics activities. Director Tillman Jr goes on to track the nascent recording star's trajectory from this promising start, through his constant philandering, his love/ hate relationship with West Coast rapper Tupac Shakur and on to the bitter, ultimately homicidal, rivalry between the East and West Coast rap scenes, which was to bring to an abrupt, permanent end to both men's careers(n)

programme.title: Under Siege 2: Dark Territory
programme.desc: In this actioner, a CIA operative aboard a hijacked train is being held hostage by mercenary terrorists, led by strategic arms genius Travis Dane, who is threatening to blow up the world if he and his group do not receive a billion dollars. Dane has the technology to do it too, as just before he was fired from his government job he managed to launch a special satellite that can set off any of the world's nuclear missiles at Dane's command. Unbeknownst to the villain, the CIA-agent Casey Ryback--who had boarded the train with his adolescent niece to take her back to her father's funeral--is a far more formidable foe than Dane ever could have imagined. Even though 50 men oppose the hero, with his combination of brains, skill and luck, he manages to defeat them all, but not before plenty of action occurs aboard the speeding train(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: 40-Year-Old Virgin star Steve Carell steps into the telephonic shoes of television's most beloved bumbling detective in this big-screen adaptation of the hit 1960s-era comedy series created by Mel Brooks. The evil geniuses at KAOS have hatched a diabolical plot to dominate every living man, woman, and child on the planet, and their plot gets under way as they attack the headquarters of the U.S. spy agency Control. As a result of the attack, the identity of every agent working for Control has been compromised. Realizing that the only way to thwart KAOS' evil plan is to promote eager but inexperienced Control analyst Maxwell Smart (Carell) to the rank of special agent, the Chief (Alan Arkin) reluctantly teams Smart with Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway) -- a veteran super-spy whose beauty is only surpassed by her lethality. With no real field experience to speak of and nothing but sheer enthusiasm and a handful of fancy spy gadgets to help him accomplish his deadly mission, Maxwell Smart his new partner, Agent 99, will be forced to faces malevolent KAOS head Siegfried (Terence Stamp) and his loyal army of minions in a decisive fight that will determine the fate of the free world. Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, David Koechner, Terry Crews, and Ken Davitian co-star(n)

Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. Directed by Tim Burton, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children was adapted from Ransom Riggs' debut novel of the same name(n)

programme.desc: Friendship becomes rivalry and the quest for fame becomes obsession in the virile epic produced in part by Ridley Scott and featuring gripping portrayals by Academy Award nominees Brad Pitt as Jesse and Casey Affleck as the youth drawn closer to his goal ... and farther from his own humanity. Everyone in 1880's America knows Jesse James. He's the nation's most notorious criminal, hunted by the law in 10 states. He's also the land's greatest hero, lauded as a Robin Hood by the public. Robert Ford? No one knows him. Not yet. But the ambitious 19 year old aims to change that. He'll befriend Jesse, ride with his gang. And if that doesn't bring Ford fame, he'll find a deadlier way(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Set amidst the burgeoning Seattle alternative music scene of the early '90s, Singles follows a group of twentysomethings as they try to find love and try to come to terms with their passage into adulthood. Arranged as an episodic comedy, the film follows a group of friends who live in the same apartment building and hang out at the same coffee shop. The central couple is Steve Dunne (Campbell Scott) and Linda Powell (Kyra Sedgwick), a pair who meet at an Alice In Chains concert and eventually fall in love. Singles follows the tumultuous relationship between Steve and Linda and their friendship with Janet Livermore (Bridget Fonda), who is trying to win the affection of grunge-rocker Cliff Poncier (Matt Dillon). The film also has a number of cameos, including actors Eric Stoltz, Tom Skerritt, Peter Horton, director Tim Burton and the film's author/director, Cameron Crowe. From the musical side of the fence, Singles features appearances by Sub Pop executive Bruce Pavitt, musicians Chris Cornell (Soundgarden), Pat DiNizio (Smithereens), Tad (Tad), and Pearl Jam's Eddie Vedder, Jeff Ament, and Stone Gossard, who play Dillon's backing band, Citizen Dick(n)

A woman Tony Pullings photographed in 2003 tells the lawyer that he hosted parties that Linda attended, leading Emma to confronts Staine about the new revelations, but he refuses to help her track down Pullings. Meanwhile, the Simms family visit MP Matthew Wild to seek his help. Will he find a way of obstructing the exhumation that is vital to Emma's case? Thriller, starring Helen McCrory.(n)

programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: New series. Broadcaster and journalist Piers Morgan travels across the USA to meet some of America's most notorious female murderers, in a quest to discover what drives a woman to kill. He travels to Lowell Correctional Institute in Florida to talk to Rebecca Fenton, convicted for the murder of her husband Larry, who was shot dead in their home. He also looks into the details of the case, learning how for several years it seemed she was going to get away with the crime, until the involvement of the FBI helped bring her to justice.(n)

programme.title: The Kyle Files
programme.desc: Jeremy Kyle returns to tackle more high-profile issues affecting people's lives, beginning by looking at Britain's obesity crisis and how the nation's eating habits have changed. He lifts the lid on the competitive world of eating challenges, a craze from America that involves people consuming huge portions of food within a time limit, and visits a fast-food restaurant in Las Vegas that encourages customers to eat calorie laden, unhealthy meals in the name of education.(n)

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary & Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders' Little Mo).(n)

programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team are called to Runcorn, Cheshire, by Karan Waller, who wants to thank her family for all the support they have given her as she battles a brain tumour. Her garden is the smallest the crew has ever tackled, so Alan is determined to make the best possible use of every inch of space. David Domoney builds bespoke seating from slate that also incorporates handy storage, Frances Tophill demonstrates ways of maintaining colour in the garden all year round, and Katie Rushworth helps to create an extra planted area on the roof of the new shed. As an additional challenge, the experts transform Karan's front garden into a welcoming, flower-filled paradise.(n)
