programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Bideford in Devon, where Tamsyn and Alex Wood's lives have been turned upside down in the last three years. Having emigrated to the south of France with their four children, they were forced to return to the UK after Alex suffered a brain injury followed by two haemorrhages. Alan sets his team the challenge of transforming the Woods' garden into a coastal haven, inspired by Alex's passion for surfing and the home's proximity to the sea. David Domoney upcycles a boat to create a bespoke daybed, Katie Rushworth turns old fruit barrels into raised planters and Frances Tophill introduces swathes of hardy flowers mixed in with paths of shingle.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress goes in search of a bogus water board official who has been robbing the elderly, but ends up investigating a suspicious death linked to one of the burglaries. Meanwhile, Blaketon seeks to rectify a miscarriage of justice by reviving a pre-war darts tournament between the Aidensfield Arms and the White Lion, and Gina begins to get cold feet about her impending marriage to Phil. Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Samantha struggles to cope with the reality of her recent discovery and takes desperate action which leaves her life hanging in the balance as Nurse Taylor races to reach her. Frankie and Gordon attempt a daring rescue to help a teenager in danger on the weir, while Ken has something to hide from Harper. Rural hospital drama starring Anna Madeley, Scott Taylor and Robert Daws.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny confides in Du Plessis that he intends to ask Alice to marry him, but the arrival of his stepdaughter Olivia threatens to derail his plans. When the family's cheetah Jana becomes sick and needs a kidney transplant, Danny realises he must save her to salvage his relationship with Olivia. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Deon Stewardson, Dawn Steele and Olivia Scott-Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Robin uses the threat of a roving mouse as an excuse to spend the night in Chrissy's bedroom. Comedy series, with Richard O'Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Miss Jones falls for new guest Hilary, a budding playwright who sends Rigsby into fits of jealousy by offering her the starring role in his latest masterpiece. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter and guest Peter Bowles.(n)

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: When Mildred gets a part as an ugly sister in the local panto, George makes the near-fatal mistake of pointing out that she has been typecast. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress goes in search of a bogus water board official who has been robbing the elderly, but ends up investigating a suspicious death linked to one of the burglaries. Meanwhile, Blaketon seeks to rectify a miscarriage of justice by reviving a pre-war darts tournament between the Aidensfield Arms and the White Lion, and Gina begins to get cold feet about her impending marriage to Phil. Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica hits the road to promote a new book club, but promptly finds herself plunged into a messy case involving plagiarism, blackmail and murder. Angela Lansbury stars, with a guest appearance by Ian Ogilvy.(n)

programme.title: The Booze Cruise
programme.desc: Five men set off on a shopping trip to a French hypermarket, determined to stock up on cheap champagne for a wedding, but a succession of disasters turns the journey into a nightmare. To make matters worse, cantankerous fellow traveller Maurice drives the Channel-hopping adventurers up the wall with his constant moaning, and the wives back home take full advantage of their husbands' absence. One-off comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Pearson, Brian Murphy and Mark Benton.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the child's grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty).(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The father of a missing schoolgirl demands action, angry that a six-month investigation has failed to uncover any leads. Morse ends up being assigned the case - and discovers some unpleasant truths about her family and teachers during the course of his inquiries. John Thaw stars as the Oxford detective, with Kevin Whately, Peter Woodthorpe, Peter McEnery, Elizabeth Hurley and Frances Tomelty.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: The lure of easy money beckons once again as Terry and Arthur appreciate the commercial possibilities of cheap tobacco, but it is not long before the would-be smugglers are all at sea. Comedy, starring George Cole, Dennis Waterman and Ray Winstone.(n)

programme.title: Cash Cowboys
programme.desc: Antiques experts Scott Cozens and Sheldon Smithens search for rare finds and delve into the stories behind their purchases.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar finds a suspicious building in Wales which is being used as a research laboratory, plunging him into the midst of a spine-chilling adventure. Spy drama, directed by and starring Roger Moore.(n)

programme.title: Ironside
programme.sub-title: Split Second to an Epitaph - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Chief is still in a vulnerable position in hospital as the police get closer to tracking down the killer. Police drama, starring Raymond Burr and Don Galloway.(n)

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: When a man is killed in a hit-and-run outside Danny's bar, the medical examiner discovers the woman believed to be driving the vehicle was a friend of his current partner Jenny. Drama, starring Jack Klugman and Val Bisoglio.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is repaid a debt in dodgy £20 notes, but by the time it comes to light they are counterfeit his creditor is heading on a flight to India. Once the Winchester is pinpointed as the source of the forged currency, Arthur also finds he has Chisholm breathing down his neck. Robbie Coltrane and Art Malik guest star, with George Cole and Patrick Malahide.(n)

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny goes to a motor show with a rare 1960s delivery car, Mike gets himself in trouble, and the team makes a couch out of a coffin.(n)

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin is dazzled by a pick-up truck, while Danny helps a customer track down their classic car. Meanwhile, an unexpected visitor causes chaos in the shop.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick takes a trip to England and visits his friend's pawn shop. Will Rick feel outclassed when he discovers that Regal Pawn owns a piece of the Titanic? Reality programme chronicling the daily activities at the World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are in for a memorable day thanks to an original blueprint for Illinois State Penitentiary's electric chair, and a convincing replica of the Blues Brothers' Bluesmobile. Reality programme chronicling the daily activities at the World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar investigates the suspicious deaths of five company directors, who each received a card with the words `The Scales of Justice' printed on it prior to their demise. However, he finds his inquiries frustrated by the remaining members of the board. Roger Moore stars.(n)

programme.title: Ironside

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: A couple of cat burglars break into a Mexican museum and take $4million worth of jewels then seal them in the floor of their boat. Unfortunately, the holidaying Quincy finds himself in the thick of it when one of the crew is found poisoned in the nearby harbour. Jack Klugman stars.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine some sex education records from 1948 and a Las Vegas sheriff's department handbook.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to the far north of Australia to the area where a light aircraft carrying a group of aboriginal elders was forced to ditch in the sea. Six men found themselves in open water, and then disappeared - almost without trace. Only a single severed leg was ever recovered, but what is in these waters that can take out half a dozen capable men leaving barely a clue? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Car Crash Britain
programme.desc: Part one of two. The popularity of personal cameras mounted on bike helmets and drivers' dashboards means that many shocking road accidents and near-misses across Britain are now being recorded, uploaded and shared online, from motorway pile-ups to hit-and-run incidents and out-of-control cyclists. This programme presents some of the worst crashes, greatest escapes and most astonishing moments captured by these miniature eyewitnesses, alongside interviews with motorists and other road users caught in the drama.(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: The seaside resort of Amity is terrorised once again by a man-eating great white shark. While police chief Brody struggles to alert the townsfolk to the magnitude of the danger, a group of teenagers - including Brody's two sons - is adrift at sea in waters hunted by the shark. Thriller sequel, starring Roy Scheider, Lorraine Gary and Murray Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey gets some financial advice, while the team tries to make deals on a 1960s car and a baseball scorebook.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An official film prop from The Godfather makes its way into the shop, as does a piece of 1950s bowling equipment. Meanwhile, tensions build between Chumlee and the Old Man. Reality programme chronicling the daily activities at the World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The Big Fish Off
programme.desc: Team captains Ali Hamidi and Dean Macey return with the competitive angling show, and are joined in the Cotswolds by boxing legends Ricky Hatton and Johnny Nelson.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Following CEO Crystal's whirlwind visit, a dejected, jobless Joyce tries to relax by the pool, but her morning is ruined when the new manager reinstates Jason Gallagher (former Brookside star Philip Olivier) at the bar. And when Janey and Jason find a letter offering Joyce a new job, they formulate a despicable plan. Elsewhere, the Oracle opens up to Noreen while trapped in a lift with his mum for the day, but who will take advantage of his predicament to make a move on Ionela? Clive falls victim to a dishonest holiday-home saleswoman and her accomplice. With Nadia Sawalha (Celebrity Big Brother) and John Challis (Only Fools and Horses' Boycie).(n)

programme.title: The Road
programme.desc: The world is devastated by a cataclysm that wipes out all the plants and animals and leaves the few remaining humans desperately struggling to survive. A man and his son make an arduous journey across a desolate America inhabited by cannibals, in search of sanctuary further south. Drama based on Cormac McCarthy's novel, starring Viggo Mortensen, Kodi Smit-McPhee, Charlize Theron, Robert Duvall and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Road

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: A lovelorn, smooth-talking minstrel turns to Robin and his outlaw band for help in rescuing his beloved from the Sheriff of Nottingham's clutches. Michael Praed stars.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna's life hangs in the balance as she's held at knifepoint by a runaway mother with a dark secret. Some good news lifts Sam's depression over the death of a patient and romance blossoms between Andrew and receptionist Dawn. Another slice of rural medical life, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Joseph Millson.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Scandal threatens to engulf Eaton Place as news spreads that James, already heavily in debt, has made one of the Bellamys' servants pregnant. Period drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Jean Marsh and David Langton.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's first day back at work after his suspension proves a harrowing experience for all concerned as he announces that he's planning to leave for good - a revelation that leaves both Christine and Sunita downcast. A guilt-ridden Sam witnesses the human cost of drug dealing and the death of a youth who suffered a massive epileptic seizure presents Judy and Danny with a dilemma.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick's relationship with Kate suffers when he goes for a job interview in London, and Greengrass is convicted for sheep rustling, although holes in the evidence are discovered. Meanwhile, Alan Maskell leaves the area while on bail for and unbeknown to him, his wife suffers a miscarriage at the same time. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Brideshead Revisited
programme.desc: Lord Marchmain returns to Brideshead with his mistress Cara, who tells everyone he has come home to die. A family feud breaks out about the fate of his soul, and Julie summons a priest in the hopes of reconciling the old man with the Church. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: The outlaws rescue King Richard the Lionheart from a gang of vagabonds - but his gratitude proves disappointingly short-lived. Drama, starring Michael Praed.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Dawn fears her breast cancer might return, and Joanna regrets her reaction to a patient's request for cosmetic surgery, while plucky local copper Pete Greenhalgh faces an adversary even his courage can't protect him from - a potentially fatal brain condition. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Nick Stringer.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Kate is confronted by a young pregnant village girl while practising as a partner with the elderly local GP. Nick takes a call saying that a flasher has been sighted on the moors. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth longs for a baby, but Lawrence is incapable of consummating their marriage and asks Sir Edwin Partridge to step in and help save it. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: The team plan a farewell party for Robert on his final day at St Vic's, but Christine is in the doldrums at the prospect of him leaving and can't bring herself to share Jack's enthusiasm for their wedding. Sam is mortified to learn James has paid off the drug dealers and their relationship is left dead in the water when his pregnant wife turns up unannounced at Robert's party. Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A wealthy banker goes missing while walking from his country house to the village post office. Poirot, who has acquired a parrot and developed a taste for conjuring tricks, bets the baffled Inspector Japp £5 he can solve the mystery without leaving his own apartment. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Captain Hastings is staying with friends when wealthy heiress Mrs Inglethorp is murdered. He calls in Hercule Poirot to help him solve the baffling crime, which has the whole household under suspicion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth, with Hugh Fraser, Pauline Moran, Anthony Calf and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.desc: Philip and Elizabeth tell Paige more about the family business, but pressing new questions arise when an operation takes an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, a sensitive package jeopardises Oleg's life back home.(n)

programme.title: The Level
programme.desc: Nancy's personal and professional lives collide when she sees a connection between her mother and the missing truck, as the full extent of Frank's monstrous crimes becomes clear, and she is forced to operate outside the law to prove her case against Nash. Hayley is let down by her ex-husband, leading Quinn to offer some much-needed comfort that provides food for thought, while Cherie doesn't seem to want to face the truth when Hayley asks her some probing questions. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Following the suicide of Jeanie Long, the woman convicted of the murder of teenager Abigail Mantel 11 years earlier, new evidence comes to light exonerating her. DCI Vera Stanhope reinvestigates the case, but to find out who really killed Abigail, the detective must uncover the secrets of a close-knit community that is still coming to terms with the incident. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Telling Tales, guest starring Hugo Speer alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Wunmi Mosaku and Paul Ritter.(n)

programme.title: The Blackheath Poisonings
programme.desc: Part one of a three-part Victorian murder drama, starring Christine Kavanagh and Zoe Wanamaker. The Collard and Vandervent families are outwardly respectable, but inwardly they seethe with lust and greed. When Roger Vandervent dies under mysterious circumstances, his son Paul sets off on the investigative trail - one that will split families apart.(n)

programme.title: The Blackheath Poisonings
programme.desc: Part two of three. Investigations into Roger's death cause members of the family to act strangely - and another suspicious death upsets the situation further. Christine Kavanagh, Zoe Wanamaker and Julia St John star.(n)

programme.title: The Blackheath Poisonings
programme.desc: Part three of three. Paul concludes his investigation into the mysterious murder of his father Roger. Christine Kavanagh, Zoe Wanamaker and Julia St John star. Last in the series.(n)

Whimsical drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, Prunella Scales and Nigel Hawthorne.(n)

programme.desc: Prince John arrives at Sherwood with a mysterious prisoner in tow, and the outlaws hatch a plan to rescue him - little suspecting the effect he will have on Marion. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Praed.(n)

Meanwhile, Joanna tries to make peace between a terminally ill woman and her daughter, but fears the rift may be too deep to heal. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies.(n)

programme.desc: Greengrass attempts to turn events to his advantage when a remote farm is raided, and a visitor from London evokes bad memories. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth spends Christmas apart from Lawrence, confessing her sorrows to her parents, but a surprise lies in store for the Bellamys. Meanwhile, tension brews between Hudson and Thomas. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star.(n)

programme.desc: Robert shocks his partner Issy by revealing that he's prepared to pack in work to help look after their new baby, while in her boss's absence, Christine's professional judgement is tested when a burns victim faces almost certain death. With Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.desc: The sleuth is called in to investigate when the UK's prime minister and his secretary are kidnapped in France. However, he has only a day and a half to solve the case before an important conference is set to take place. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth receives several anonymous letters outlining a killer's intention to murder a succession of people in alphabetical order, prompting him to try to unmask the culprit before the body-count mounts. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective delves into the past of extreme sports enthusiast Gideon Frane after he plunges from a cliff in a ball of flames. A scan of the files reveals a long list of stalking complaints against an ex, and an anonymous letter to the victim spelling out Burn in Hell is linked to one of her friends. Aided by DC Shepherd and the newly appointed DC Edwards, the team tries to track down Gideon's old gang to uncover a lifetime of bullying and an unexpected story of rough justice.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The officers remove a number of cats from an apartment after their owner is evicted. Some of the felines are in bad shape and need help urgently.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal Cruelty Investigators arrive at a property to rescue some horses, but have a surprise in store when they discover a litter of puppies trapped inside a storm drain.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Bradyn Fuksa, who vanished in July 2009 after taking a mysterious 10-hour journey from Kansas to Wyoming before abandoning his vehicle.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of the Agofsky brothers, who abducted a banker from his home and forced him to open the vault at his workplace before throwing him off a bridge. It took the FBI five years to gather enough evidence to convict them.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of high school student Brandon Wentzell, who fell for Clarissa Chistiakov online. However, Chistiakov was a fake identity and its creator Jessica Boudreau led Wentzell on, inadvertently towards abusing alcohol and painkillers to his untimely death.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The presenter examines the case of a missing man who checked in with his family via text and social media. However, there was something suspicious about his messages.(n)

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: The case of Erick Westervelt, who in 2004 fell in love, had his heart broken, and was charged with murder. Retired homicide detective Chris Anderson and defence attorney Melissa Lewkowicz investigate the evidence.(n)

programme.title: Grave Secrets
programme.desc: The case of 69-year-old Loretta Bowersock, who in December 2004 disappeared while shopping. She was discovered in a shallow grave two years later, as a long-time boyfriend came under suspicion.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The search for a murder suspect that led police to arrest two conspirators involved in the plot, who later implicated the victim's ex-husband.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators who use minute scraps of evidence to discover the full story behind a murder and solve serious crimes.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Keith Reed, who was gunned down on his doorstep. A possible crime of passion was placed in doubt after a surprise discovery, with CCTV footage being called upon to unravel the mystery.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The case of Veronica Bozza, whose body is found on her living room floor. It sent shockwaves through her community and a bizarre, unexpected twist was uncovered.(n)

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Investigators unravel a tale of adultery and greed as they try to solve the case of a family man murdered at a shopping centre 15 years earlier.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Florida mother-of-four Andrea White, whose body was found floating in a pond dressed in nightwear. Immediately prior to her death in July 2005, she was in the process of arranging a divorce from her husband David, who was eventually found guilty of the crime.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Kelly Eckart, an 18-year-old who disappeared after finishing her shift at an Indiana hardware store in September 1997. Her car was discovered abandoned by the side of the road, still running and four days later, her partially naked body was found in a ravine. Workman Michael Overstreet was eventually convicted of the crime after eyewitnesses reported seeing him in the area and DNA evidence provided a solid link.(n)

programme.title: Killing Richard Glossip

programme.title: Killing Richard Glossip
programme.desc: A look at the contradicting views around Glossip's case, from the detective who zeroed in on him to the confessed murderer, who claims Glossip forced him to kill.(n)

programme.title: Killing Richard Glossip
programme.desc: A look at trial mishaps, potential governmental corruption, and Glossip's current lawyer's final attempts to save his life.(n)

programme.title: All the Goals
programme.desc: Focusing on former United striker Dwight Yorke.(n)

programme.title: All the Goals
programme.desc: A look at Dimitar Berbatov's goals in the red shirt of United.(n)

programme.title: MUTV Gold - Old Trafford 24

programme.title: PL: United v Liverpool 07/08
programme.desc: Action from the Premier League clash at Old Trafford.(n)

programme.title: La Philosophie de Cantona
programme.sub-title: La Philosophie de Cantona: The Art of Rebellion.
programme.desc: Over 20 years since signing for United, this documentary examines Cantona's personal philosophies. With exclusive contributions from Eric's family.(n)

programme.title: Cantona at 50
programme.desc: Happy 50th Birthday to Eric Cantona. This is a new and exclusive MUTV interview with Eric when he sat down with Stewart Gardner ahead of his visit to Old Trafford in May.(n)

programme.title: UCL: Roma v United 07/08
programme.desc: The Champions League group match.(n)

programme.title: Wembley '77: Que Sera Sera.
programme.desc: Exclusive documentary looking back at one of the most significant FA Cup finals in United's history. This is the story of how the team bounced back from defeat, in this showpiece occasion.(n)

programme.title: UCL: United v Roma 07/08
programme.desc: United Archives. After victory at the Stadio Olimpico, the Reds welcomed Roma looking to take advantage of a two-goal aggregate lead and secure a semi-final tie with Barcelona.(n)

programme.title: Zlatan: The Year Of The Lion
programme.desc: What a first season it was for Zlatan Ibrahimovic. Here we look back at his arrival at United in 2016 and how his season unfolded both on and off the pitch.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kent couple Chris and Sue, who are struggling to decide whether to downsize locally in Royal Tunbridge Wells, or make a completely new start in life by moving to the south of France. With this in mind, she demonstrates what their budget could buy them on the Cote d'Azur.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick pushes the boundaries of veterinary medicine, and treats an Alsatian puppy that needs surgery on his hips and front leg using groundbreaking cell treatment. The vet must also perform delicate surgery on a Chihuahua suffering from a neck deformity compressing its spinal cord - however, one false move could be fatal. Plus, a rescue dog with deformed front legs is brought into the surgery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners of the African-themed Foxholm B&B in North Yorkshire begins another competition, trying to prove their establishment offers the best value for money. Julie Janes and Yvonne Quinsey initially impress their guests with a cupcake class, but tempers fray when John Shields makes an unfavourable remark about German-born Sigrid.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wendy Johnson and John Shields welcome their rival hoteliers to the Pack Horse, an American diner-themed B&B in Lincolnshire, for the second round of the competition. A horse-riding session turns sour when Steve Reed takes a dislike to Nick Lawler, and matters get worse over dinner - before a pancake shortage at breakfast causes problems for the hosts.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Sigrid Reed host at their Glenwalden B&B in Blackpool. They hope ballroom dancing will entertain the guests, some of whom object to the pink flock wallpaper and knitted toilet roll holders. Nick Lawler seems to be warming to the owners, but one of them suspects his change of heart is all part of a cunning plan.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nick Lawler and business partner Kate Wilson host the competition at the Winder Hall Country House B&B in the Lake District, but a clash of egos ensues when they try to lecture the other participants about how to manage their hospitality establishments, and a disastrous breakfast service leaves contestants unimpressed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Jasmine Harman help a couple who have lived in the same home for 40 years decide between new properties either side of the Channel. Sheila is drawn to Bodmin, Cornwall, where she spent her childhood holidays, while Fred is keen to up sticks to Limousin in France.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his group of intrepid archaeologists head to a muddy field in Wickenby, Lincolnshire, where a metal-detector enthusiast uncovered a treasure trove of Roman and Iron Age coins. As relations become strained between experts with conflicting opinions, the team takes action to discover what was really happening at the location 2,000 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Bodies in the Dunes: Outer Hebrides.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his crew head to the windswept Isle of Barra in the Outer Hebrides, where stormy weather is literally blowing away more than 4,000 years' worth of archaeology. The team investigates a Bronze Age burial ground and uncovers an Iron Age settlement with everyday detritus still intact.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Hartlepool, Co Durham, where they attempt to restore a 1971 classic Volkswagen bay-window campervan that is in desperate need of some tender loving care.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick performs a risky procedure to save the life of an 18-week-old cockapoo puppy that has fractured its neck following an accident in the garden. He also comes to the aid of Romanian stray Geoffrey, who was found abandoned and emaciated before being adopted by Kent couple John and Stacey, and an accident-prone cat called MK who has fallen from a window.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows a project by artists Freddie Robins and Ben Coode-Adams to convert a large, Grade II-listed timber-framed barn in Essex into a family home and workspace. Their plans involve a minimal number of interior walls to display their collection of toys, but at seven times the size of an average three-bedroom house, the transformation of the 500-year-old building proves extremely challenging.(n)

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: Documentary shedding light on whether there is any truth to conspiracy theorists' suggestions that London and Washington had been aware the Japanese were planning to assault the American naval base at Pearl Harbour in 1941, but refused to act on the intelligence as part of a plot to bring the full might of America's military into the Second World War. In the wake of the attack, an investigation into how US forces failed to anticipate the assault concluded that Admiral Husband Kimmel, Commander in Chief of the Pacific Fleet, had been guilty of dereliction of duty, a charge that left his career in tatters. Making use of new research into a top-secret US military project, as well as thousands of freshly unearthed documents, letters and photographs, this film aims to answer - once and for all - whether the brutal attack that claimed nearly 2,500 lives could have been prevented.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow couples as they cope with treatment, including Corey, who's 27. He is rushed to St George's after suffering a cardiac arrest during a game of ice hockey, and his wife of seven days, Alice, was watching him play when he collapsed. There's also a profile of John, 55. He fell 10 feet while taking down scaffolding at home, and his spouse Penny talks about how he has supported her through sickness and bereavement during their marriage.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This edition shows the devastating effects that so-called legal highs can have on users in one community and the huge strain their use is putting on already stretched emergency services. In Warrington, PC Karl Dickin is one of eight officers sent to detain a man in his 20s who's taken a cocktail of illegal and legal drugs and is acting erratically, while a regular user is found coughing up blood at a bus stop.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah & Mason's, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentine's Day - the busiest night of the year.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow couples as they cope with treatment, including Corey, who's 27. programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.sub-title: 8 Out of 10 Cats: The Best Bits.
programme.desc: Extended highlights edition of the irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr. Teams captained by Jon Richardson and Sean Lock answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country, with guests including Charlie Brooker, Sarah Millican, Gok Wan, Jack Dee and Jedward.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. He also comes to the aid of Romanian stray Geoffrey, who was found abandoned and emaciated before being adopted by Kent couple John and Stacey, and an accident-prone cat called MK who has fallen from a window.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners of the Sea Verge Hotel in Paignton, Devon, try to prove their B&B offers the best value for money. However, Tony and Chris Fulbrook's guests are far from happy, with Christine Hale complaining about the noise from the sea and scolding Chris for serving breakfast in her slippers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves on to the Portcullis Hotel in Chipping Sodbury, Gloucestershire, where mother-and-daughter owners Christine and Jenna Hale make a poor first impression by cajoling their guests into taking part in a karaoke session that runs until 2am. Matters worsen the following day, as a caricaturing workshop does little to alleviate the tension among the contestants.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Andy Scott hosts at the Orchid Hotel in Bournemouth, and takes on Richard Bailey in the boxing gym. Christine and Jenna Hale are unhappy to find foreign objects in their beds, and a spot of flirting is brought to a swift halt when the owner receives some negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last hosts of the week are John and Debbie Fox from Friary Wood near Bath, who are hoping to impress their guests with the spacious en-suite rooms and a cocktail-making course.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple have decided to sell their family home to fund their dreams of a house abroad. Jonnie Irwin helps them look for a smaller house in Cirencester where they already live, while Laura Hamilton takes them around properties in western France where they want to spend their retirement.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple on the verge of retirement decide between homes either side of the Channel. While Tony has his eye on Shropshire, an area he feels is familiar and beautiful, Kimm is drawn to the French way of life the Dordogne offers.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Gold in the Moat: Codnor Castle, Derbyshire.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team brave treacherous mine-shafts to piece together the layout of Codnor Castle in Derbyshire, former residence of the De Grey family, who fought in almost every important medieval battle. The excavation lives up to expectations when the team uncovers the remains of a large round tower and a drawbridge.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Towcester, Northamptonshire: The Naughty Nuns of Northampton.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his crew of archaeologists investigate a collection of relics discovered in the garden of a suburban family in Northamptonshire. Among the artefacts are what appear to be a collection of unusual sarcophagi from the ruins of Sewardsley Priory, a 900-year-old nunnery linked at various times in the past with witchcraft, begging and debauchery.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Car enthusiast Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Leicestershire to rescue a Jaguar E-Type. After ill health turned school caretaker Mick's dream of owning one the 1960s supercars into a nightmare, the team is on hand to get the iconic car back on the road.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Stonemason Adam Purchase and his partner Nicola Brennan try to restore a dilapidated Grade II-listed silver-mine engine-house in Cornwall. With a budget of £100,000, Adam takes a year off work to transform the property into a new home, but has to rely on favours to complete the project before he runs out of time.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps Oxfordshire sellers Colin and Teresa, Ben and Donna, and Larry and Lynette give their houses a makeover in the hope of winning an offer from buyers Polly and Paul.(n)

programme.title: The Baby Boomers' Guide to Growing Old
programme.desc: Seasoned celebrities explore alternative ways to make a living, though journalist Eve Pollard and campaigner Stanley Johnson struggle as assistants at a DIY store.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.(n)

programme.title: A Wild Dog's Tale
programme.desc: This is the amazing true story of a lonely female African wild dog that has befriended a number of other predators and is helping to raise jackal pups in the Okavango Delta. Once there were plenty of wild dogs living on Mombo Island in the centre of the delta but competition from hyenas and lions decimated the dog packs. Today only one lonely female dog remains. Her name is Solo. Her two male companions disappeared three years ago, presumed killed by lions. What makes this wild dog exceptional is that she is friends with a number of hyenas and jackal families, taking them hunting and providing food for them. For the last two years Solo has helped the jackals raise their pups, regurgitating food for them as if they were her own. The pups accept Solo, as she feeds, grooms and protects them, even chasing away her old hyena friends that wander dangerously close. Living in a land of lions Solo benefits from her friendships as the jackals are forever alert to approaching danger. But when a pack of wild dogs suddenly appears Solo has to make a choice - to stay with her adopted family or join her own kind(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross travels to Northern Ireland to find that, more than 15 years after the Good Friday peace agreement, the country is still deeply divided. Setting out to discover what makes people on both sides reluctant to let go of the past, he meets taxi drivers who offer tours of the sites of the Troubles, sees the towering `peace walls' that keep the different communities apart and witnesses a peak in the violence during the July marching season. He also accompanies police officers to see how they try to keep the peace as the bottles and bricks rain down on the first of four nights of protest.(n)

programme.title: Karl Pilkington: The Moaning of Life
programme.desc: Karl Pilkington travels the world in search of answers to some of life's most important questions. He begins with marriage, wondering whether he is wrong about not wanting to tie the knot with his long-term girlfriend. In Delhi, he gains an insight into arranged marriages by going on a date with a prospective wife - and her parents - and in Bangalore, he is asked to help a pair of elite wedding planners. He also sniffs out a scientific approach to finding the perfect partner in LA, before searching for an alternative way of getting hitched in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross visits the Middle East, where Lebanon is on the brink of civil war. In Tripoli, Sunni Muslims are fighting Shia Muslim Alawites in a battle that mirrors the war in neighbouring Syria. Their frontline is a mile-long street, the buildings on each side riddled with bullet holes and RPG explosions. Ross visits both sides of the conflict, spending time with the fighters and those caught in the crossfire.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: At Northumberland's Chillingham Castle, Sir Humphrey Wakefield prepares to hand over the estate to his apprehensive son Maximilian. Hard-working staff at Carlton Towers in North Yorkshire get ready for the arrival of 120 caravan owners for the annual rally and dinner dance.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He begins in London at St Paul's Cathedral, where he visits a place tourists never go, before exploring a hidden park and a little-known church. He also gets a guided tour of Soho from broadcaster Danny Baker.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing

programme.title: The Curse of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau vanishes without trace and another detective must be chosen to solve the mystery of his disappearance. Glad to be rid of the bane of his existence, Clouseau's long-suffering boss makes sure an even more inept investigator gets the job. Comedy, starring Herbert Lom, Ted Wass, Joanna Lumley, David Niven and Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Answer The Call
programme.desc: Melissa McCarthy and other cast members of the rebooted Ghostbusters discuss the blockbusting 2016 comedy.(n)

programme.title: The Bad Education Movie
programme.desc: Incompetent teacher Alfie Wickers decides his students deserve a treat for somehow passing their GCSEs, so decides to take them on the greatest school trip of their lives - to Cornwall. However, a series of disasters leaves the class into trouble with suspicious locals. Comedy, starring Jack Whitehall, Harry Enfield and Iain Glen.(n)

programme.title: Loser
programme.desc: A hard-working college student is branded a loser by his roommates, who promptly oust him from their group. When he helps a girl deal with an unpleasant drugs-related experience, he falls madly in love with her - but she only has eyes for a professor. Comedy, starring Jason Biggs, Mena Suvari, Greg Kinnear, Zak Orth, Thomas Sadoski and Dan Aykroyd.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: A baseball player is stunned to learn he has come into a massive inheritance. Unfortunately, there is one condition - he must somehow find a way to spend $30million in just one month, or he will lose the lot. Meanwhile, two scheming lawyers, who stand to get the money if he fails, are determined to sabotage his efforts. Comedy, starring Richard Pryor, John Candy, Lonette McKee and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Barbershop: A Fresh Cut
programme.desc: As their surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, the crew at Calvin's Barbershop come together to bring some much-needed change to their neighbourhood. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Cedric the Entertainer and Regina Hall.(n)

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: A Nascar racing champion has everything he could want - until an arrogant French rival seizes the title from him, and his wife runs off with his best friend. Forced to move back in with his mother, the downhearted driver turns to his estranged father for help rebuilding his shattered self-confidence. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: A stressed businessman just wants to make it home to spend Thanksgiving with his family. However, when his flight is forced to land miles from its destination, he finds himself sharing a disaster-strewn journey across America with an amiable but slobbish salesman. Comedy road movie, starring Steve Martin, John Candy, Laila Robins, Kevin Bacon and Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Barbershop: A Fresh Cut
programme.desc: As their surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, the crew at Calvin's Barbershop come together to bring some much-needed change to their neighbourhood. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Cedric the Entertainer and Regina Hall.(n)

programme.title: Hitch
programme.desc: A professional relationship guru, who specialises in offering advice to lonely single men, helps an unlucky-in-love accountant to woo the girl of his dreams. However, when he finds himself falling for a beautiful gossip columnist, his usual charm abandons him and he discovers his expertise counts for nothing. Romantic comedy, with Will Smith, Eva Mendes, Kevin James, Amber Valletta, Julie Ann Emery, Adam Arkin and Michael Rapaport.(n)

programme.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
programme.desc: A series of sketches examining mankind's secrets and taboos through the trials of life from conception to death. Surreal comedy, starring the Python team of Michael Palin, Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Terry Gilliam. Featuring introductory short film The Crimson Permanent Assurance.(n)

programme.title: Bad Bromance
programme.desc: Dan Landsman prepares to attend a high-school reunion, and hopes to make a good impression on people who never had any time for him in his teens. To that end, he tracks down a famous classmate to persuade him to attend - but is unprepared for the consequences of letting the celebrity into his life. Comedy, starring Jack Black and James Marsden.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Norbit
programme.desc: A timid man's life is ruined after he is bullied into marrying an overbearing, overweight woman. However, a more hopeful future beckons when he bumps into his childhood sweetheart and realises she is his one true love - but first he has to pluck up the courage to confront his tyrannical wife. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy in multiple roles alongside Thandie Newton, Cuba Gooding Jr and Terry Crews.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: A male stripper who retired from the stage three years ago is persuaded to put on one last show. A troupe of dancers are also planning to call it a day and recruit him to headline their final show. The guys head off on a road trip to the venue, making some new friends and picking up a few new moves along the way. Drama sequel, starring Channing Tatum and Joe Manganiello.(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Calamity ensues when two party-loving brothers attempt to find respectable dates for their sister's Hawaii wedding. Comedy, starring Zac Efron and Anna Kendrick.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: A couple on the brink of divorce sign up for relationship therapy on a tropical island, but find they can save money if they persuade their friends to join them. Three more couples go along for the holiday, thinking they do not need any help - but the unconventional treatment soon exposes cracks in their relationships. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn, Malin Akerman, Jon Favreau and Jason Bateman.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Calamity ensues when two party-loving brothers attempt to find respectable dates for their sister's Hawaii wedding. Comedy, starring Zac Efron and Anna Kendrick.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
programme.desc: A Kazakhstani journalist is sent to the United States to learn about the country and its customs. However, when the inquisitive reporter stumbles across an episode of Baywatch featuring Pamela Anderson, he becomes convinced she is his future bride and embarks on a reckless mission to track her down. Spoof documentary, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Ken Davitian and Pamela Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch
programme.desc: The odd couple return for this animated sequel, in which the lovable, loopy alien gives his adopted family more problems thanks to a major malfunction. With the voices of Dakota Fanning, Tia Carrere and Holliston Coleman.(n)

programme.title: My Favorite Martian
programme.desc: A TV journalist meets a stranded alien who is trying to repair his crashed spacecraft. After first planning to exploit the chance of a big story, he instead offers his help after befriending the visitor - but a fellow reporter plans to expose the truth. Sci-fi comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Christopher Lloyd, Jeff Daniels, Elizabeth Hurley and Daryl Hannah.(n)

programme.title: Piper
programme.desc: Animated Pixar short, directed by Alan Barillaro. A mother bird tries to teach her little one how to find food for herself, but encounters a traumatic experience.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck barman is having a hard time coping after his wife leaves him and he loses his teaching job. His fortunes turn around when the American football team he has supported all his life holds open trials and, against all odds, he wins a place on the squad. Fact-based sporting drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
programme.desc: A science student creates an invisibility spray, an invention that could help save his college from financial ruin - but it soon attracts the attention of a gang of scheming crooks wanting to use it for more dishonest ends. Disney adventure, sequel to The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes, starring Kurt Russell, Cesar Romero, Joe Flynn and Jim Backus.(n)

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: A bumbling, short-sighted senior citizen unwittingly ends up in the possession of a valuable jewel during a mix-up at a museum exhibition, and is blissfully unaware that a Brazilian crime lord, a female cat burglar and the FBI are on his tail. Comedy based on the cartoon series, starring Leslie Nielsen, Kelly Lynch, Malcolm McDowell, Ernie Hudson and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Son of Flubber
programme.desc: An eccentric inventor thinks he can make it rich by developing a means to control the weather, but his efforts end in as series of disasters. Disney's comedy sequel to The Absent Minded Professor, starring Fred MacMurray, Nancy Olson, Keenan Wynn and Tommy Kirk.(n)

programme.title: Summer Magic
programme.desc: A hard-up widow moves into a rambling old house in Maine, where she struggles to control her three quarrelsome children. She also has to deal with the visit of her snobbish cousin, who falls for a schoolteacher her teenage daughter has her heart set on. Disney musical comedy, starring Hayley Mills, Burl Ives, Dorothy McGuire, Una Merkel and Michael J Pollard.(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Hound
programme.desc: An orphaned fox cub is taken in by a kindly widow, and becomes firm friends with a puppy belonging to a hunter. However, as they grow to adulthood, the dog is trained to prey on foxes, and the two animals realise their friendship may not survive as they are expected to be natural enemies. Animated adventure, with the voices of Mickey Rooney and Kurt Russell.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: A Bug's Life
programme.desc: Well-meaning ant Flik lands his colony in trouble when he accidentally disposes of an offering meant for a swarm of greedy grasshoppers - who promptly promise a horrible revenge. Faced with the imminent destruction of the anthill, he sets out to save the situation by enlisting the help of a few would-be heroes - an out-of-work troupe of bugs from a low-rent flea circus. Pixar animation, with the voices of Dave Foley, Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Jungle 2 Jungle
programme.desc: A businessman ventures deep into the Amazon to look for his estranged doctor wife seeking a divorce, only to discover he has a 13-year-old son who has been raised as part of a jungle tribe. The boy is sent back to New York with his father, but has a lot to learn about the modern world. Comedy, starring Tim Allen, Lolita Davidovich, Martin Short, JoBeth Williams and Sam Huntington.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
